Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: SKSAL
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the positive TA reviews and we were really pleased with it. The hotel is some distance from town, but close to tram stops, which take you in within about 15 minutes. We also got a taxi home one night and it was only 21 euros, which we thought was reasonable. The hotel itself is large with really good rooms. The rooms are very clean, well decorated and have lovely bathrooms with bath and separate shower. They also have satellite TV with UK and European channels. We ate in the hotel prior to leaving and the food was pretty good and reasonably priced. The hotel also has a great secure car park facility, which is actually within the hotel unlike many that we encountered in our travels and was reasonably priced at 15 euros per night. The hotel also has wifi and offers free access to a pc, printer etc, which makes a change from the hotels that charge for these facilities. The only down side to our stay was the 35 euros that we paid for a 'treat me special' package, which included bath robes, slippers, turn down service, with water and fruit delivered to your room. The turn down service didn't happen on either night we stayed and we mentioned this to the hotel who then reduced the cost to 25 euros. This is the only thing that we could find fault with though, so pretty minor. Considering the cost of this hotel compared to its city centre competitors, I think it offers brilliant value for money and having seen some of the alternatives that we looked at, we are glad we chose to be in this area rather than the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back”
Reviews.Author: EndsBirds
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice staff - staying there since month on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: olivierp2008
Reviews.Content: Fashion hotel is really a nice place to stay. The rooms are big, bright and modern. Beds are really confortable and bathroom includes shower and separate bath tube. WC are separates from the bathroom...which is a rare "nice to have"...... Hotel has free wifi everywhere, which is also rare in Europe. TV package has program in all languages. The hotel features a very nice facility area including swimming pool, spa, and fitness. There is also a lounge/bar on the top floor which offer a nice view of the city. Staff is very helpfull. The only downside is that the hotel is located about 20 minutes away by tram from the entertaining district. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who travels to Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Chilling”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, huge comfy bed, very helpful and friendly staff. The swimming pool and gym are good, pool nice and warm. Wish the use of sauna was included but you had to pay extra to use it, seems a little crazy to me cannot cost any more to run as they are being heated anyway. Food was excellent and the wine list complimented the food. We have already booked to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Be VERY careful if you are a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Pedro C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 4 times in this hotel when coming into Amsterdam for business. I find the location (close to the airport and next to a highway) convenient. However, for the SECOND time now they have failed to provide a wake-up call when one was requested. The first time this happened, two months ago, I went to the front desk, explained who took my request the prior night (did it in person at the desk), and indicated how lacking a hotel-provided alarm clock all guests are dependent on this service. I received a rather hollow apology. I expected a follow-up from the manager. None came. Then, it just happened again this week. This time I called from the room to request a 7:30AM wake-up call, and again, no call came. I was late to my meeting and potentially embarrassed myself in front of my clients. On the way back I stopped by a convenience store and bought a travel alarm clock. With a front desk service that bad It is ridiculous that no clocks are in the room. Rooms are nice, although very cold (other reviews indicate the thermostats don't work and my impression is the same). Cleaning crew is hit and miss. Sometimes the rooms are nicely put together when you come back, sometimes they are not. Iron boards left out will be found in the same place when you come back at night (really? Putting them back is not part of fixing up the room?). Restaurant is good, but if you do not watch it they will serve you beer in a dirty glass (they go straight from the soapy water into the shelf). Keep an eye on the glass they use, or order bottled beer if picking up bugs is not part of your travel plans. Overall, it is not a bad choice for business, but do NOT depend on a hotel provided wake up call because for me, they did not come in 50% of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: Druopera
Reviews.Content: I only booked this place because the hotel I usually use whilst in Amsterdam was fully booked, but it was lovely. I really enjoyed my stay. However, hard as I tried, I could not warm to the location. It was a cold, empty, sterile, concrete jungle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in efficient location”
Reviews.Author: rjaarts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in connection with a visit to the Keukenhof, downtown Amsterdam and old friends. We had great weather and then the 30 minute walk to the center, through the Vondelpark, is a joy. In the evenings the metro system brought us back nicely (but we didn't stay in town past midnight) The room was very nice, the beds and shower excellent and the (free) swimming pool was a nice addition. The breakfast is good, but at 18â‚¬ expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Easter break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BrisaInDublin
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel, though location is not the greatest - if you aim for night life, must be aware of public transport times, since the hotel is a bit off the centre and it's not really "walkable" there. Some kind of shuttle bus would be highly appreciated, though I must say it's only 7 minutes away from Schiphol airport by train, so quite handy. Beds are nice and rooms very stylish, but having a full glass door on the shower/bath facilities might be slightly uncomfortable for some people. Overall, great stay, specially with the discounted prices. I'm not sure if the normal rate of this hotel is a good value for money...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - ticked all the boxes for us”
Reviews.Author: OfficerCharlieDibble
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with friends for 2 nights and we all loved the hotel. Location-wise - yes it is not right in the centre but it is so easy to get to (one stop on the train and one stop on the tram) - well worth the travel. Hotel is clean and tidy with friendly and helpful staff and good sized rooms. We booked 4 rooms and all were as we requested - 2 doubles and 2 twins - and all on the same floor along the same corridor which was great. Our room had a bathroom which had a bath with shower over it, along with a separate walk-in shower as well. The toilet is totally separate (maybe the hotel could consider putting little sinks/handbasins in the toilets so that guests can wash their hands before leaving). Rooms had all facilities you could ask for - good sized, comfortable bed, flat screen tv with a choice of channels (including English ones), dressing table, plenty of wardrobe space, tea and coffee making facilities, vending machine with drinks and snacks, small refrigerated area under the vending machine for keeping drinks, etc. in, hairdryer, complimentary toiletries, small seating area with chairs and a table. We could not think of anything else we needed. The staff were very friendly; I contacted them several times by email before going and they responded quickly and efficiently, and at the hotel we were always greeted with a smile. Breakfast at the hotel was plentiful and set us up for the day, with lots of options. Unfortunately we did not have time to try the cocktail bar, restaurant or spa so cannot comment on them. I searched for deals online before booking and then contacted the hotel directly and they did us a great deal which came in at just over Â£95 per person for 2 nights including breakfast and tax. Our only regret is that we could not stay longer! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “a nice place”
Reviews.Author: julijespe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really good. rooms are big and clean. The swimming pool is nice. The staff is very helpfully. I think the location is OK because it is a quite area and in 20 min by tram you are in the centrum of the city. It is also easy go to the hotel from the airport, the train is just 7 minute until Leilylaan station and then take the tram only one stop so it is easy and quickly. The only thing that I didn't like it is that there wasn't breakfast include in the price, and it is 18 Euro extra per day and person if you want it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Krelle25
Reviews.Content: We stay here 1 night in April 2012, all was incredible good!! It is very beautiful design hotel with good location and value for money!

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: iole_12
Reviews.Content: we stayed there four nights and it was very good! the staff is friendly and helpfull, excellent room...the problem is the location, but we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: FabianSemal
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect, I aleady booked my room for next week...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rob C
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, clean, modern and contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: hostalSoleMare
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam for a weekend, and stayed only one night in this Hotel. I really wish I could have stayed there longer, cause the service was great!! The people on the reception were really helpfull, answering any question we had. The rooms were not that big but there were also not that small that you would feel uncomfortable. The best in the bedroom for me was the bed, it was so comfortable! I visited the Spa very brifely, but I could say that it is great. If I go back to Amsterdam again, I would definitly go to this Hotel again, and this time the hole weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Peter”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to reach by train from Schiphol and is at less than 10 minutes walking distance (if you don't have too much luggage to carry). The rooms are nice (modern) with very nice bath rooms (shower and bath). The restaurant is good but if you go there often, the menu gets a little boring (it does not seem to change very often). Also the Skyy bar is very nice (looks like a glasshouse on the roof) with a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Isabellebigandstrong
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable and so was the SPA. Very clean, lovely Sky-bar, good staff and everything was very spacious, fantasyful, the rooms look very sexy and the only reason wht I do not rate it with 5 stars is, because the rooms have a view on the highway. If you like to go into the centre you need to take a taxi (or perhaps public transport which I didn't in the evening) which costed me 20 Euro to go there and 20 Euro to come back. It's a discreet place and they have a big parking garage which is not free of charge. That's ashame, but understandable.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, beautiful hotel, bed is not so good”
Reviews.Author: Chantal P
Reviews.Content: I stayed for business and checked in late. Very friendly staff at the reception. Room is very nice. And quiet. Unfortunately the pillows are not good so I did not sleep well. For me this is key. So that is why i rate 3 instead of 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: MrsGHC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel as it is a very easy walk to our Amsterdam office. The hotel has a lovely gym and swimming pool. The showers were problematic on previous stays but management has taken onboard guests comments and the refurbishment solution works well. It is a very nice place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: simon D
Reviews.Content: If you are ever on business in Amsterdam this is a good hotel due to its location .Yes, its about twenty mins out of the city centre but the trams stop at about 500m away allows you easy access, (lines 1 and 17). If you have an exhibiton at the Amsterdam Rai , then a ten minute walk will take you to another tram to take you directly to the Rai in under fifteen minutes. The trams run frequently and are reasonably priced.The rooms are good , beds very comfortable and are very clean and the hotel itself has a relaxed atmosphere. Great place to stay. Downside to this hotel is the ridiculous price charged for parking ( 25 euros a day) and the 16 euros for breakfast. I understand that there is a cafe not too far away serving a nice breakfast but unfortunately could not find it, ditto there appears to be pleanty of cheap payable parking around the hotel but unless you know the system you tend to feel bound to park in the hotel. Overall I would use and have used this hotel again and again whilst on business in Amsterdam and would say that you will get a good nights sleep, which at the end of the day is the most important thing.

Reviews.Title: “OleMunich”
Reviews.Author: Ole E
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, personal, relaxed at ease and just naturally helpful and thinking ahead. Clean and nice design. All good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and very consistent”
Reviews.Author: KeenPhotographer
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveller to Amsterdam and, after trying a number of hotels, now mostly stay at the Fashion. Most important for me is the consistency - the rooms are all comfortable and there is no need to worry about which one you are given. The bar and restaurant charge hotel prices for food (i.e. more than you would pay elsewhere) but are on-site and good quality. On the whole, good value for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “verry good hotel with a little bit space for improvment in Skybar”
Reviews.Author: AndreasSa
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very good, rooms are comfortable. only the service in the Skybar is not so good as it should be. That stay was not my first stay and it will be definately not my last one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: Leslie J
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend in the Fashion Hotel. One stop from Schipol airport on the train and a ten minute tram ride from there to the city center. A quieter location than city centre which was what we were looking for. All staff very freindly and helpful. I will definately be returning. highly recommended. We had breakfast included in our package and it was excellent. Great bar staff.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but a little far to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: chigz999
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fantastic, has excellent decor and the rooms are very comfortable. The only downside is that you have to walk about 5-10 mins to the nearest tram stop and then another 10 minutes or so to get into the city. Saying that the hotel is excellent value in comparison to what you would pay closer to the city so this does compensate. The skyy bar is excellent and there is a lot of extra costs in the hotel. Regarding the parking there is actually a Park and Ride very close to the hotel which is a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - extras cost a lot”
Reviews.Author: jkfs111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, spacious, new and modern. The rooms are big with seperate bathroom and toilet. Location is good, only 5 min walk to tram station. Unfortunately all the extras in hotel cost a lot, parking is 25 Euro/day, breakfast 16 Euro, addionoal hour for late check out 10,00 Euro/each hour and the most ridiculous thing for a hotel with a pool, bathrobe and slippers cost 35,00 Euro per stay. This is abusive and for a hotel of this category simply unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: About 10 minute from the bulldog coffee shop! Alot better than some of the other hotels in the same price range

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay here!”
Reviews.Author: fataliegarlic
Reviews.Content: I was taken to the Fashion hotel as a birthday present in November 2011. It was easy enough to find when we got directions from staff at the tourist information point in the airport. The hotel is very modern and funky and our room was spotless. The room had everything needed for a few days away! Staff at reception were very friendly and helpful! The day we arrived the trams were off as workers were on strike so we had to pay a bit extra to get a taxi to the city centre. This hotel is a bit out of the city centre but I liked that it was. We had some difficulty finding our way back from the tram to the hotel on the second night, but that may have had something to do with experiencing some of Amsterdams culture..haha! Breakfast was nice and there was a good variety of food. We used the pool on the last day, there was no-one else in it so it was very relaxing...staff down here weren't just as friendly as the actual hotel staff. I would definitely stay here again on a return trip to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a "twist"”
Reviews.Author: Anouck A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend, conveniently located near the highway and with private parking space. Although it is not situated near the city centre, it has easy access to public transportation which takes you right into the heart of Amsterdam in 10 min. Rooms and amenities were fine. Nice bathroom, a bit on the small side but clean. Breakfast was great, good variety. Only downfall about this hotel was the fact that we got woken up at 3.00 am due to a fire alarm, allegedly caused by someone taking a shower. The whole evacuation plan was deployed and everyone had to rush out of their rooms. 5 min later the cook informed us it was a false alarm. Not really a professional way of handling things in our opinion. When we mentioned it the next day whilst checking out we just got a cold: â€œoh I heard about that, this is what you get when someone takes a long showerâ€¦â€� Again no apologies which we believed were in order. Apart from this glitch we would recommend this hotel for people looking for a good place to stay during a city trip.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm away from the hustle and bustle!”
Reviews.Author: littleev
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I was a bit concerned about this hotel being a bit out of the centre but I needn't have worried. Getting to the hotel from the airport was easy with 1 stop on the train from the airport. We did not bother to get a tram as recommended by the hotel but instead asked the first passer by where the hotel was (almost everyone speaks English which is a bonus) and they were happy to point us in the right direction. It was about a 10 - 15 minute walk which probably works out the same as getting on and off the tram just for one stop. Walk to the tram stop to centre is about 8 minutes (which will be quicker when the road works are completed). Getting to the Centre is about 15-20 minutes on the tram depending on what number you get and we found the No.1 was the quickest and you could get off at Leidseplein which is close to the Museum area and various bars etc. The tram drivers were helpful and would alert us to where to get off. As others have said, get a transport card at reception which is good value for hopping on and off trams. Breakfast was a good variety of hot and cold offerings with enough to set you up for the day if you could manage it! Rooms are very spacious and very clean with lots of storage space. The glass door in the bathroom was not a problem and when in use the glass steams up so it obscures the user. Our room was on the 6th floor and it was very quiet and the bed was the best hotel bed I have ever slept in. There are not any shops around the hotel so if you need any supplies, get these in town. We did not use the restaurant so we cannot pass comment but it did look a little bit expensive. The staff all speak English and we found them all helpful, caring and very friendly. We had a great stay at this hotel and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: Jamie G
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good and helpfull staff, and very trendy rooms. It's a tiny bit out of the way, but well worth the money and extra time it takes to get into town (which you wont notice too much). The best way we found to get into town was either a little walk to the tram 5 mins or so or get a cab (about 15 Euros to Leidseplein where you have casino's, clubs, bars, pubs etc...) The only thing I will say is if your not going as a couple and sharing a room with friends, beware the bathrooms. They have glass doors so you can see through into them while people shower and it might bother some people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: scan099
Reviews.Content: This hotel is approx 20mins via tram from central amsterdam. The tram stop is about a 8-10min walk from the hotel, you do have to walk under a bridge but this was well lit but could be a bit daunting for solo travellers. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly the rooms were spotless and of a good size, there is a clear bathroom door but that didn't bother us, the toilet is separate and does not have a clear door. Breakfast was included in our stay and there was a vast selection including waffles, pancakes, fruit, cereals and foods to make a full English breakfast. From Schipol Airport you can get a train to Amsterdam Lelyln station this is approx 15mins walk and costs â‚¬2.70 this is much more direct than going to Amsterdam central. A taxi to the hotel is approx â‚¬33.00. The tram service stops at midnight but the 17 & 1 go from central station every few minutes we would reccommend the 3 day tram & bus pass which was â‚¬16.30 the hotel stop is Derkinderenstraat. The alcohol prices in the Skyy bar were comparable with prices in Amsterdam but food was overpriced other than that would stay in this hotel again and would recommend it. We didnt use the wellness centre or the swimming pool. We had a problem with the TV and they were there to repair it within 5 mins. Some people have said the rooms overlooking the road were noisy we were on the 6th floor and didnt have any issues with noise from traffic.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely break with fantastic accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: We were aware that the hotel was outside the main centre and were fine with this as the hotel was a great price and looked lovely! It is just one stop on the train and two stops on the tram from the airport taking about 20mins in total. The tram stop from the hotel is about a 7minute walk which was absolutely fine. You can see the hotel from the tram stop. We arrived about 10.30am and were able to check straight into our room with no hassle. We also purchased the "spoil me" package which included bath robes, flip flops, fruit, luxury toiletries, turn down service and a cocktail each at the Skyy bar. It also included a late 15:00 check out which was very handy as we did not leave until late. Our room was clean, tidy and modern with a fabulous bathroom. The sliding glass door separating the bedroom from the shower room was no issue for us as we were there as a couple and the toilet is in a separate little room with proper door! The food in the lobby bar was very good and we ate there two nights. The food on the menu in the hotel restaurant was a bit too fancy! We were a little disappointed with the Skyy bar as it was not busy and seemed to lack atmosphere. We basically just had our free cocktails there and left! We expected it to be a lot bigger and a lot more lively from previous reviews, but maybe this was just the time that we were there. We used the pool in the Wellness Centre free of charge and the staff we encountered there were very happy and helpful. We would recommend getting the 3 day tram pass for â‚¬16 and this can be purchased on the tram or from reception at the hotel. Breakfast was included in our stay and there was a vast selection including waffles, pancakes, fruit, cereals and foods to make a full English fry up! Overall we had a fantastic trip and would highly recommend this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Ace hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RuthandNick09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a girlie weekend and loved it! I read some mixed reviews before going. As I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel, I will clear up the negatives that other people mentioned. Firstly, the clear bathroom door! Yes, it's ruddy see through all right! It is possible to position yourself in the room so that you cannot see someone in the shower. Laugh it off, don't let it be a deal breaker. Secondly, rude staff. We did not experience this at all. All of the staff we spoke to were very friendly and helpful. Finally, the last tram back is around midnight. This is either an issue for you or it isn't. In summary, the hotel is spotless, the swimming pool and skyy bar are fun and we had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain & lovely city break”
Reviews.Author: babyblue1982
Reviews.Content: Just come back from spending 5 nights at this hotel. Lovely 4* hotel, with no complaints what so ever. Rooms were lovely and big. We booked bed and breakfast and the breakfast was very nice each morning. Reception was very helpful with any information we needed.The location was great. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel which cost around 30 euros, then we used the trams everyday and bought a pass from reception for 21 euros. Was just a short walk to catch the main trams into dam square, central station and Leidesplein. Would definately recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fashion but not good value”
Reviews.Author: Beverly031
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to have a room on 9th floor away from the main road as we asked for. The room is nicely decorated with a good color scheme: dark brown and white form a good contrast. The downside is a separate toilet without a washing basin, which is inconvenient in the evening. The glass panel of the walk-in shower is not wide enough, water would run out a bit to the floor outside. The design of the room looks very nice but not so practical. The bathroom and bedroom were very well cleaned each day, but hanging bar inside the wardrobe was quite dusty. The air in the room was a bit dry and we had to open the window in the evening. It is quite expensive consider its location, time of the year we stayed, plus an extra 5% city tax (over 12 Euro for 3 nights) to pay in the end.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jess029
Reviews.Content: Me, my Fiance and another couple chose this hotel for a short break in amsterdam. The hotel is lovely, the lobby very decadent and staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 8th floor room 805, this was fantastic, nice space, well decorated and very clean. The toilet is seperate to the glass door shower area, we had no problems with this. The bath is the deepest i have ever been in, take bubble bath. Once settled in we were greeted with a complamentory bottle of champers which was very nice. The rooms have a large tv which has bbc 1,2,3 and cbeebies (just incase your traveling with kids). The sky bar was fab, the cocktails to die for and all very well priced for a hotel bar and amsterdam prices. There was a lovely chilled vibe and I would recommend a visit during your stay. The hotels breakfast was well above average, with lots of fruit juices, tea, coffee ect. Hot english selection including bacon, sausage, beans, mushroom, egg and hash brown. Lots of fresh fruit and the usual continental options. The area which you have your breakfast is also very nice and relaxing. The location, we found no problem with it, we timed the walk to the tram stop and with four of us walking and talking it took 8 minutes, and as for the road work complaints from other reviews, this became a little joke between us as we saw one very small pile of rubble. Thetram to central station takes around 20 mins however Lidensplien (thats spelt totally wrong) is only 5 mins away on the tram and is full of bars, shops and resturants. Over all i would give this hotel a huge 10/10, i loved it! I will be returning. Thank you fashion hotel for a lovely base and very friendly service during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Hanz6490
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel late February and do not have a bad word to say! Very clean, beautiful rooms and excellent service. Went to celebrate a birthday and received complimentary champagne on arrival and had no problem checking in at 10am Breakfast was brilliant full English, fruit, cereal and continental breakfast available along with all hot drinks and juice. About a 20 min tram ride to the centre and a 5 minute walk to the tram stop so don't listen to those people saying it's an issue, it's really not. Would rather stay in a fantastic hotel like this outside of the centre than pay more to stay in a hotel that isn't as nice in town. Will definately be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Spoono
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous modern hotel with a quirky style. Location Hotel is about 20 mins on tram from Amsterdam Central Station, takes quite long as there are many stops. Tram is 7euro for a day ticket and around 3euros for a single ticket. Tram clean and stops about 2 minuets walk from the hotel. Some roadworks going on as the area looked like a new development. Hotel situated by busy link road and centre to far to walk. Supermarket about 15 mins walk. Checking in/out Reception spacious and very helpful & friendly staff. Room accessible by KeyCard. City tax is required (about 3 or 4euro per night) quite surprised that when i booked a 100euro deposit was required, turned out all they wanted was to view my passport, and deposit was not needed. checking out at 12 the next day, long queue to check out had to wait about 30 mins, get their early! Room Hotel over all was great. VERY clean, everything neat and room perfect. Spacious room with free wifi and large t.v, large wardrobe. Shower and bath and separate toilet. All furniture in room looked brand new and was comfortable. There is a vending machine (small) in room for drinks and snacks, also coffee/tea making facilities. Also a standard size iron & ironing board. Leisure & Pool Great pool and seating area, drinks also available to order here. Staff very unfriendly in leisure area, they did not allow my boyfriend to use the gym as they didn't think his gym wear (shorts & t-shirt) was 'suitable' and was told in a very rude manner his trainers were 'too dirty' for the gym. Male receptionist nice, but steer clear of the rest! they obviously hate the hotel stayers using the facilities as it looks like its not owned by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol T
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 9.30 am and were able to check straight in. Even changed rooms to two adjoining as 4 friends in our group. Rooms are large with comfortable beds and great bathrooms. People have complained about the glass bathroom doors but we didn't have a problem with these. Frosted glass allowed light into the room. Much more pleasant than normal internal bathrooms! We were on the first floor and didn't see another person when leaving and coming back to rooms! Very quiet. We swam both mornings as the spa opened. Good way to start the day. We didn't have breakfast but the was a great cafe 5 minutes walk near the canal. We purchased tram tickets from reception, 48 hour ones and made good use of them. Easy to get to the tram stop - better when the road works finish! We also purchased canal trip tickets from reception - 3 for the price of 4. Cheaper than those bought from the trip booths by central station. Had a fantastic trip to Amsterdam. Will definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but disappointed about the spa!”
Reviews.Author: mimi h
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice, staff was very friendly and helpful, breakfast was poor, they have a very big breakfast room, first when you come in you are very impressed, but then you see that they have only a little choice of ham and cheese, the eggy and potatoes were cold, no fresh juices, coffee was not very good,.... most i was annoyed with the spa area.You have to pay extra â‚¬10,- to use the sauna, because the spa does not belong to the hotel, it is a separate company. Furthermore they told me at the reception (and it is also written on the information sheet and internet) that the sauna, steam bath and pool is open until 10 pm. I went to the spa at 9 pm and the lady told me that she has to shut down the sauna at 9.35 pm and i have to leave the spa latest at 9.50 pm... so i had to pay â‚¬10, thinking i could use the sauna for 1h....so i donÂ´t understand why they tell you it is open until 10pm. i was really angry... about the location, you have a tram directly to the centre, but you have to walk for about 5 minutes to the station...

Reviews.Title: “The Facts”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Whitfield
Reviews.Content: Arrived early (11am) no problem checking in. Michael was very helpful & informative. I suspect we were in a standard room. Not large, but very clean, and big enough for short stay. Bed wonderfully comfortable. As intimated by other reviews, bed & wet area separated by glass screen only. No problem if you are a couple. Separate toilet, but with no hand wash facility. Went to sky bar once. Quite trendy & cocktails were very good, but took a very long time to serve them. Got the impression cocktail waiters thought a bit too much of themselves! Breakfasts very good but slightly variable; different options on different days. Very busy on Sunday morning. Congratulations to the chef who somehow managed to stay calm! Onto the location. Obviously out of town. The tram stop currently 8 minute walk away, due to the roadworks. Once done I suspect it will be 5. Somebody has said a 20-30 minute walk into town. They must have been running! Having said that we did it one day and it was a very pleasant slow stroll through Vondelpark taking about 1 hour. In conclusion an excellent hotel provided you don't want to stop in the centre. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: portisheadblue
Reviews.Content: We "found" this hotel through easyjet holidays ... it 's in a very convenient location for us to viist with family living the Pijp district, easy access from Schipol and there are trams to the Dam Central too. This is a very fashionable hotel ... it starts with mannequins everywhere, some clothed and some not but it all adds to the ambiance. The room was excellent ... a large and very comfortable bed with multiple large pillows (unusual in Europe), two comfly chairs and an "arty" chair at the desk area ... plenty of work space if needed too. There was a lot of hanging space if you are there for more than a weekend too. The bathroom had a very deep bath and a separate large shower, interesting tiles and a the wash basin .... included were daily updates on the toiletries. We expected continental breakfast (cold meat, fish and cheese) which we got plus the eggs, bacon, beans, mushrooms etc and the waffles and pancakes .. and all the bread toast muffins croissants etc plus the range of cereals and fruit and juices ... even soya milk if you ask. We had bar snacks in the main bar one night where the service and food were excellent. There is also a SKYY Bar on the top floor where lots of younger people were enjoying themselves. There is not much going on in the local area but we found two good bars just near the entrance to Vondelpark about a 6 minute walk away. All the taxi drivers know where the hotel is ... be aware that once you have gone past the minimum fare the taxi cost rise quickly ... the last 5 euros will be spent negotiating the junction next to the hotel to get you to the door. We spent three night and will stay here on our next trip in April. The free WIFI works right in the bedroom too. All the staff we met were very courteous and helpful and all spoke excellent English. we

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great value and only ten minutes tram to Leidseplein”
Reviews.Author: Lightyearz_B
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was fab - the rooms was luxorious and very modern - the bed and linens really comfortable, and the bathroom with shower and separate bath was great. The hotel facilities itself were again very modern and new, breakfast was delicious - a great selection of hot and cold foods and served until 11am at the weekends In terms of the location it not right in the centre, but it's a five minute walk straight down the road to the tram stop Suriname (lines 1 and 17) and less than ten minutes to Leidseplein. They were so frequent - every few minutes. It is such a good value high quality hotel - if this was right in the centre you'd probably be paying at least double the rate per night. Tram stop was easy to find - there was building works on the carriageway but they didn't cause us any problems as if you look carefully you will see that there is a small path still passable! My thoughts about people's previous comments is that they saw the works and didn't look carefully enough because you can get past! It's really easy to get to from Schipol as well - just get the train from Schipol to Amsterdam Lelyann (one stop) and then one stop on the tram (either 1 or 17) - you can be there from the airport in 20 minutes. We would definately recommend and return!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eye S
Reviews.Content: Second time my wife and I have enjoyed the pleasure of staying at the Westcord Fashion Hotel. Staff are very helpful and friendly, rooms are clean and nicely designed. Food and service in the restaurant is absolutely fantastic as is the sky bar's atmosphere on saturday evening... the swimming pool and wellness area is a nice way to unwind after a day in the city or before going out in the evening. The location of the hotel is easily attainable by tram (number 1 or 17) about 12mins from Dam Square, the tram stop is a pleasant 5min walk from the hotel which could be a problem in bad weather or for the disabled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and functional, poor location.”
Reviews.Author: grouchy_traveller
Reviews.Content: Couldn't decide between average and very good. The staff tipped the balance, but room for improvement. Reception, Sky Bar and Wellness Centre staff were excellent. If you are driving, this hotel would be great. But, in snow, the direct route to the nearest tram (1 and 17) stop (or to Lelylaan station) was unsafe (no pavement), and the other route was down stairs and clockwise round a part-underpass, part open-construction-site, part office block. Another, and safer option was the stop nearer town, just a little further. The last tram was midnight. Trains to Lelylaan didn't seem to run any later. Not convenient for the night bus, so if you want to party, it's probably not the place for you. Airport taxi was 30 euro to the hotel, 33 euro to the airport. Breakfast gets an A. Sky Bar A+ for cocktails. Not really a great view, but a nice ambience. Lunch ... service was pleasant, but really slow at times. 45 minutes for a toastie? The Spa/Wellness centre was very nice. The hotel was, as a whole, functional, calm, quiet, clean, well run, but not terribly exciting. Basic looking beds, but nice deep pillows and warm quilt. Slept like a log. Shower/bath arrangement could be weird in company, unless you're born to flaunt it, but shower very good. Would I go back? Yes. Good service tips the balance. But more likely in the summer when I could rent a bike, or stroll to town through Vondelpark.

Reviews.Title: “Fab service from a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fionnuala H
Reviews.Content: I will echo what the previous reviewers have said on everything except for one thing: When I went down to the pool for a late night swim, the staff there could not have been more helpful and polite. Maybe they have been spoken to since the previous bad reviews or maybe the staff were just having a bad day and we caught them on a good one. The service of the hotel is very efficient and we enjoyed our stay. The trek to the tram stop through the snow may be a bit much for older travellers, but it was a good challenge for us and only a 5 minute walk at that. Milk in the bedrooms would be nice as the powder version is awful. The glass doors to the bathroom was not an issue for us, but for friends travelling it would prove to be a problem. The hotel manager would be advised to look at frosting the whole door or sticking a coloured vinyl on to achieve this and keep guests happy. The food in the restaurant was a little on the pricy side, but then i found that everywhere in Amsterdam. It was however wonderfully cooked and delicious. After a day in the snow, some decent warm food in my belly was welcomed. Cocktails in the skybar were yummy and the staff very friendly. The views are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: bartmx2
Reviews.Content: I don't want to repeat what other visitors to this hotel had to say but I've stayed here twice now, both for business, and I have to say that the hotel is very relaxing and easy-going. The most remarkable things for me are : 1. the very secure car parking (which is underneath the hotel and closed of from the outside by a aluminum entrance gate. 2. the exhaustive and delicious breakfast, very complete and made to everybody's taste. And yes, even if you go at 10am there's still something left :-). Most of the platters are well monitored so probs there. 3. the clean and fresh looking rooms, spacious, with separate toilet. Minibar is a bit expensive tough. 4. the skybar is exellent for the view and even more for the cocktails. Expensive but worth it. Be on time and you can also have some nice things to eat, they have a choice of small platters which are to die for ! 5. in the weekends you'll notice that the surroundings of the hotel are really deserted because it is surrounded by big business buildings. But very clean and it feels safe to do a little jog. Recently I tried the XXL room, but really, the standard XL is enough for me. I will go back, certainly, because there is no hazzle dazzle for the car (parking is extremely expensive in amsterdam, really!), you leave the hotel smiling after the good breakfast and because the traffic noise does not wake you up at 6 am !!

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way but well worth a trip.”
Reviews.Author: Rayleigh_Em
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Fashion Hotel in March 2010 for 4 nights, room only. As far as location goes, it's a bit out of the way but there are tram stops nearby which make it really easy to get to the centre. The hotel itself and rooms were impeccably clean and very well decorated. We had a lovely large, comfortable bed in our room and I liked the fact we had a separate toilet and bathroom. The cocktail bar on the top floor provided lovely views and a fun atmosphere. We swam in the pool and used the sauna a couple of times. The facilities are good. The staff are very helpful and excellent at English (as you would expect from the Dutch). If I went back to Amsterdam, I would definitely stay here again despite the location.

Reviews.Title: “Designhotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Carl042
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable, new, modern and fresh interior decor, fantastic skybar and very friendly staff! Taxi â‚¬20 to city and â‚¬25-30 to RAI. Value for money and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish, friendly hotel with good food and beer”
Reviews.Author: AHEdin12
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a quick break! It is slightly outside of the city centre but its only 5/10 mins on the tram or a 30/40 minute walk through a nice area of town! Very easy to get to and from the airport too! Everyone was so helpful at the hotel and the food was great....really recommend the breakfast as it really sets you up for the day! The Sky Bar was very nice too, serving all types of spirits and beers as well as tapas style food which was nice. The bar downstairs also has some great beers and i think everyone should try one of their burgers! The rooms are very tidy and the beds were very comfortable! There was a slight sheen of dust (i didnt notice - my girlfriend pointed it out...) on our first day but it was tidied without us asking by the time we got back the next day so no points deducted there! Reception was very helpful and they also give you the option to pay in Euros or Pounds which was convenient. I would say that it is better to have a room facing away from the road if possible though as you could hear the buzz of traffic if you are in a lower room facing the ring-road but reception can sort this out if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy”
Reviews.Author: cloggie1954
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to find with the car. Hotel has a carpark with a price which could be reduced when staying longer. Fitness centre-sauna-swimming pool nice set up. Public transport is near by but due to contruction works hard to reach

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: lmf1soton
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful long weekend at this hotel in a standard room in January. The staff were friendly and courteous, the rooms immaculate and well-appointed, and the communal areas simply beautiful. We enjoyed the pool area and gym very much, which are free for hotel guests to use. We would also recommend purchasing the "treat yourself" package for around $30 euros. The hotel is extremely easy to reach from the airport (20 mins in total, fare $3 euros per person). If you have cases on wheels don't bother with the single stop on the tram - just walk from the train station. Amsterdam was equally easy to access - 10-12 minutes. Remember to buy a 24hr tram pass from the concierge at the hotel...makes life cheaper and easier. We really have no complaints at all. The only minor issues were the breakfast, that, although delicious, was expensive at $16.50 euro per person. We also found the staff in the pool/spa area less helpful than the reception staff. They didn't seem overly happy that hotel guests could use their facilities for free.

Reviews.Title: “As a tourist poor location, may be different for business users.”
Reviews.Author: T_leeds
Reviews.Content: Visited Feb 2011. Myself and girlfriend stayed here our friends stayed elsewhere. We chose here because it looked nice on the photo's and the rooms lived up to it. Problem was when you looked out of the window the view was pretty pants. Looking into a half constructed area. The see through bathrooms were how can i put this.. revealing.. you could see your partner do everything. The rooms were very modern and nicely decorated, one might say fashionable? The biggest problem I feel was the location. It was just annoying to get into the main part of Amsterdam for a tourist. (This may differ for business guests though). Didn't eat there or use the spa. Hotel was nice and had no problems with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in December 2011 for 3 nights. The hotel is about a 15 min tram journey from the centre of the city, which is very easy to negotiate and well worth it for the standard of hotel. Our room was very cosy, comfortable and with a fantastic bed! The bathroom was very well equipped with both bath and powerful shower. Breakfast was excellent, with a great variety of continental items (cereals/pastries/waffles/breads/cold meats/cheese/fruit) and cooked items (bacon/sausage/eggs/mushrooms/tomato). The swimming pool/leisure area was lovely and added a nice activity to the break, especially on a chilly day! Overall the hotel was very modern and impressively stylish - a fantastic place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: jamie h
Reviews.Content: Stayed over new year and this was the best 4* star hotel i have ever stayed in. The tram station is only a 2 minute walk from the hotel, don't listen to people that say it's 10-15 minutes to the station, and if you like walking the center of Amsterdam is a 20-30 min walk and it's very enjoyable walking in. The rooms are lovely, the breakfast was great, and the swimming pool was great!! would recommend this place to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Good price”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal for a holiday, a slow walk of 10 minutes gets you to the trams that run very frequently to town centre.The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was very comfortable and well designed. I had a room overlooking the street or highway, so it was a bit noisy. The swimming pool is very nice. The breakfast was realy nice too lots to choose from. Internet connection very slow.

Reviews.Title: “good overall but....”
Reviews.Author: kelly t
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 4 nights here and overall was very nice. The room was a good size, very clean on arrival, bathroom was big and clean with massive bath. Swimming pool was great and free, not really a family hotel which was meant we could enjoy the pool without kids messing about and sauna was worth the extra euros There were a few negatives though..... A few other reviews have mentioned the location, it is a little out of town, which we knew when we booked however trams were frequent, although the last tram out of amsterdam square was 11.55, so restricted what we could do of a night. The tram stop was a 5 min walk away from hotel but because of roadworks and building sites all round was a bit of an obsticle course. Half way through our stay the bedroom doors were locked while we were out and we had to pay our bill to date before it was opened! hotel breakfast was good quality with limited options and very expensive for what there was. After first day of hotel breakfast we decided to go out for breakfast and got pancakes at a little place in town for a third of the price of the hotel breakfast. Bed sheets not changed for days, I had smudged eye shadow on one of the pillows and it was still there 2 days later... not great for a hotel that says it has high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: PamWeightman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fashion Hotel for 3 nights from 2nd jan.. Arrivied at 10.30 and way too early for our checking in time, however we were given our room right away with no extra charge.. The room was modern, spacious and clean.. Breakfast was great also food in the lobby bar was tasty.. The sky cocktail bar is well worth a visit.. All staff were very friendly and helpful.. The tram stop was only minutes away and had no problem with finding it.. It's a great way to get around and takes you into the city within 10minutes.. We bought a 4 day travel card from the reception which was worth the â‚¬19 each.. Would definitely stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkPupu
Reviews.Content: A very nice and modern hotel with a pool and a well equipped gym. Because of the roadwork the nearest tramstop is rather challenging to find..

Reviews.Title: “4 day break in December 2011 in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lee1963
Reviews.Content: Booked this deal thru Travelzoo. Really good price. Â£239 for 3 nights bed and breakfast including return flights from Bristol. Really easy to get to the hotel from airport. Train station at airport and one stop to Lelylaan costing about 2 euros each way. Five to ten minute walk from Lelylaan Train Station to hotel. Hotel was really lovely. Shame I forgot to take my bathers, forgot about the swimming pool etc but you can buy them if you want from the hotel for 12 euros. We arrived early but only had to wait a few moments and our room was ready. Gorgeous room, really trendy just like the hotel. Gorgeous shower in the bathroom. My only complaint would be that the bathroom door is glass and you can see everything. I think all the rooms were the same. Ok I suppose if you dont mind someone seeing you sitting on the toilet! I personally dont so we took it in turns to leave the room when that time came! Michael, from reception rang us after we had been in the room about 2 minutes just to check that everything was ok. To get into Amsterdam centre, you can get a tram, a number 1 or 17, its about 2 euros for an hour ticket or 7 euros which lasts 24 hours. Its a bit of a treck to the tram stop as there are roadworks on the hotel side, so no pavement and about a ten minute walk. The hotel advised us to go this way but when its blowing a gail and raining which in our case it was, its an awful treck. We took our life into our hands and walked on the hotel side and dodged the traffic. Must quicker! The sky bar was pleasant and staff very friendly. On the Friday night tho we couldnt use the sky bar as there was a function going on there so sat in the downstairs bar area. We ate at the hotel on the first night from the bar menu. Steak sandwich and chips and it was fine. Breakfast was a choice of the usual fruit, salamis, cheese, ceareal etc but also a cooked breakfast was available at no extra cost and this was all buffet style. I have no complaints with the hotel at all. Immaculately clean and staff all helpful and polite. My only reservation with the hotel is that it is a way out and after trudging the streets of Amsterdam all day, by the time you get a tram back, especially winter time, you dont really want to go back out in the evening. I think we missed out on quite a lot because of this. If I went back to Amsterdam again I would definately stay more central enjoying the flexibility of being able to pop back and fore to the hotel room and also saving on transport costs which in all cost us over the 4 days, 56 euros.

Reviews.Title: “WestCord Fashion Hotem A'Dam, December 2011”
Reviews.Author: Gen G
Reviews.Content: Hi, The hotel is really lovely. I spent only one night but the staff were friendly, room was clean and warm, breakfast had a good selection very relaxing and calm restaurant to have your breakfast in by the way... I didn't know A'dam very well so it took me some time to get my head round with the trams, trains, bikes etc. but finally got there... Just one thing could you please make sure you have milk in the rooms for English guests as we like our tea white :) Thank you again overall it was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic..Book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkCharlee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, up to date and trendy. When we arrived 'Merrete' was very nice and was throughout our stay. Nico was very warm and so was Chanice. We came for my husbands birthday and the hotel made his birthday a one to remember. The room was lovely, clean and modern. Lovely bath. My husband loved the comfy pillows. Wifi is good no problems connecting. I was a bit wary of breakfast because of previous reviews but it was great, lots of options and was our favourite meal of the day. I would suggest you include it in a package beforehand. Sky bar was nice a little cold though. The cocktails were devine. The view cannot be helped as it is by the roads but it was high up for me. One night we came back at 11.45pm and was starving the guy at sky bar suggested we go down stairs as the kitchen was closed and they knew of a 24/7 pizza place. It took long for the pizza to come 50 minutes so i wasnt hungry anymore but my husband ate it. The hotel is not that far, 15 minutes away from centre and trams come frequently. And the hotel is more than worth it to travel 15 mins for.

Reviews.Title: “Not central but good quality”
Reviews.Author: WeekendTravel
Reviews.Content: It's a long way out of the centre but the tram ride is painless and the trams frequent. Rooms are good and the service is fine. The SKYY bar is a bit of a let down with a 'view of Amsterdam' only in the sense of the view of and over the ring road. Free wifi is good. Pool is fine. For the money you get a lot of room and if you're happy with the location then it's a good choice

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mia017
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying here for 4 days. Couldn't fault this hotel at all. We were a bit out from the centre but trams run all day in and out. Fantastic break away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zogform
Reviews.Content: Would recommend every one to stay here, close to transport, amazing breakfast and stunning room! Also an i amsterdam card is highly recommended if staying a couple of days, just for the transport prices alone.

Reviews.Title: “November 2011”
Reviews.Author: April J
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Amsterdam. We stayed 2 nights at this great hotel. We opted for a taxi to and from Schipol at a cost of about 35 euro one way. A bit pricey but more convenient than walking with suitcases. We were checked into our room on arrival without any problem even thought we were early, about 1200pm. The rooms are great, clean, tidy, modern with an easy to use in room safe. Bonus to have the bbc channels available. Noise wasn't a problem as we overlooked the back garden. Echoing other reviews the door on the bathroom was frosted glass, as was the window between the bathroom and bedroom. This was not a problem for us but if you are sharing with outher family members might be a bit uncomfortable. We had a large double which consisted of two beds pushed together, which again wasn't a problem. However, we would have preferred to have one massive quilt instead of 2 single quilts, and two extra pillows would have been nice but that's personal preference. One issue we had was with the room key. It was reassuring for security that you had to swipe the key to get into the hallway and the room. However 2 keys would have been ideal. As the key also turns the power on in the room it made doing things seperately in the winter evenings a bit awkward. We either went together to get ice or one of us was left in the dark for a few minutes while the other got the ice, and the same thing to go out and have a cigarette.So get 2 keys on check-in. However saying all that if any of it had really been a problem for us we could have easily remedied it by going to the main desk. The only problem we did have was when taking an afternoon siesta someone knocked the door and as my other half bolted out of bed to get it, the door opened and someone said hello. On seeing my other half they immediately apologized and shut the door. Not sure if they were doing spot checks on how well the room was cleaned or what as no explanation was offered. It could have been really awkward. I would reccommend that they knock twice before entering. Overall a great place to stay. I would reccommend it to anyone and would not hesitate to stay there again. Quick note. When reading reviews before booking I was concerned about how to get to the tramstop and how far it was from the hotel. It is actually quite simple. Come out of hotel main entrance go down the stairs,right under the overpass and turn right. Less than a five minute walk down the street is the tram stop. Tram 1 or 17 take you straight into Centraal. There was some work being done on a bridge on the main road, but they weren't working while we were there and weren't obstructing the sidewalk at all.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Just Brilliant ... amazing hotel.. The best 4 star I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Rufai A
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 2 nights (21st -23rd Nov 2011)... nothing negative to right about the hotel..i travel a lot round Europe but i must say this is the best 4 star i have stayed in... not to expensive, restaurant / sky bar is amazing... Well done guys.

Reviews.Title: “A Stunning Hotel Experience.............”
Reviews.Author: audreyclark
Reviews.Content: Having had a massive delay from Manchetser to Amsterdam my son and I were pleased to arrive at this beautiful hotel ten minutes from the city. We came by cab but spent te rest of our stay travelling by tram which was easy. I deliberately requested a quiet room away from te lifts and was duly given one. Our stay was peaceful. The breakfast was glorious and Michael on reception was curteous and helpfully enquiring. we were last in Holland in May staying at the Hilton at Schipol which was disastrous in terms of noise and getting hit on so this was a complete pleasure. Thank you so much we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: ch9nem
Reviews.Content: This is a nice modern hotel with a few funky touches. The rooms were nice, bar on the top floor was a great place for snacks and reasonable priced drinks (for a hotel). I never managed to use the pool but it looked nice enough. I did use the fitness room and found it to be well appointed although they didn't seem very keen on me turning up 45mins before closing! The surrounding area isn't best but it isn't too far from Lelylaan station which has good transport links though at the time I was there there was a lot of snow and ice and rush hour on the metro wasn't a pleasent experience due to the overcrowding (guess people weren't using there bikes as much). I wouldn't be prepared to pay normal 4* rates to stay here but I got a very good deal (around Â£70 per night I recall) which made it a stand out choice compared to the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: Philip0010
Reviews.Content: Close to city ,nice rooms and.....free wifi ! Ask for room not on streetside.Front is noicy but when window closed no noice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: becktoria101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of an easyjet holiday package, flight and 2 nights accomodation... although we did have some trouble with checking in (didnt get into our room until 4:30pm) the hotel was amazing for the money we paid, definately 4 star, rooms were lovely with the most comfortable bed ever, all very modern, with a very swanky bathroom, deep bath and really good shower, it didnt bother us that the bathroom door was glass and see through, however it may be a problem with family or friends... toilet was seperate though. The distance from the centre wasnt too bad, you could catch the tram directly opposite the hotel (number 1 or 17) and it took about 15 mins... definately worth staying that little bit outside the centre to stay in such a wonderful hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and the breakfast was AMAZING! Definately worth getting up for.

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique style hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl4105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fashion hotel for the weekend. The hotel is really modern and quirky - our room was clean and everything looked new. The Skyy bar was really good and busy on a saturday night - playing good music and great cocktails. about 15 mins away from the city centre but easy to get to on the tram!

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea201020
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve been to a lot of hotels for business trips in Amsterdam, but this hotel was really excellent and for a reasonable price. There are nice services in the hotel, such as free wifi, business area with computer and printers, indoor swimming pool (with warm water :), relaxing area, terrasse, etc. Very nice fashion rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Westcord Fashion Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nacourt99
Reviews.Content: Quite simply a 5 star place at 3 star prices. I have the same taps as them in my batrhroom - so I know what it takes to clean then. It was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommycanuck84
Reviews.Content: I only booked here because there was a large convention in town and I couldn't find a room in Central Amsterdam. Now, I'm glad I stayed here and would gladly stay again. We arrived at the hotel at 7 AM and, despite the fact that the hotel was very busy, they were able to get us into a room right away. This allowed us to get cleaned up after our long flight and get started with our day. Excellent service !! The room was spacious and clean and very modern. The bathtub was large and deep and I liked the separate shower stall. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet. While the location is not in Central Amsterdam, it is really not that far away. Each morning we walked into Amsterdam; a nice 30 minute walk through VondelPark gets you to the VanGogh Museum / RijkMuseum area. In the evening, it took a 10 or 15 minute tram ride followed by a 5 minute walk to get back to the hotel. The only draw back was that there did not seem to be a lot of eating places near the hotel. We did not try the restaurant in the hotel. The swimming area is very nice and the fitness facility is well equipped. The people working in the fitness facility are VERY unfriendly however (I believe they work for a different company, not the hotel itself). The WIFI was free and worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Path
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights Oct 2011. Very satisfied. Friendly service staff. This recently build hotel is very classy and well built and designed. The heating A/C system in the room is highly efficient and easy to set making the place very comfortable. Ok the location is a bit remote from central Amsterdam but you can enjoy a quiet night. Breakfast is a bit pricey but very good. Tip-Top WIFI network free. Big NO that should be fixed :No decent music channel on TV.

Reviews.Title: “100% worth the stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrmic19803
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated slightly out of central Amsterdam, but not too far away! The travel into Central Amsterdam is worthwhile, either by tram or foot! Don't let the location put you off, if you stay right in the centre you limit your sights and experience. The hotel itself is absolutely stunning and focused around fashion and style but in a non pretentious way. It was my birthday weekend and the staff had left me a birthday message and a voucher for cocktails at the Skyy Bar on the 10th floor. The staff are fluent in English, so for me there was no lack of communication! The rooms are spotlessly clean. Truly the best hotel I've visited. 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “nice but cold”
Reviews.Author: hayuja
Reviews.Content: we had a corner suite, huge with an amazing huge bath jacuzzi and a big terrace. the room was very nice but a bit cold (not temperature but atmosphere like). Decoration was a bit kitsh.

Reviews.Title: “a Business and Service minded Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: StefaanA
Reviews.Content: End of September '11 stayed 4 nights in this Hotel. An excellent 1st experience with the Westcord Hotels. Very friendly staff - creative and helpfull people at the frontdesk. Breakfast is an example : how to serve a good and decent breakfast. Perfect location! Not in the center of town but 10 minutes away from the most important metro & trams. Close by the Rijks- and Van Gogh museum. With the public transport ticket one can get all over A'dam. This hotel is a not only a Must Go for conferences - events in Amsterdam also for a city trip is a good choice..

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: I took my 10year old son to Amsterdam, and this Hotel was just excellent - All the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. The bed was comfortable, and the breakfast was great - a good combination of a continental and English breakfast. The location of the hotel was good, with a 10min walk to the train station or the tram stop!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Willey6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our 2 month adventure around Europe and as others have said this hotel will not disappoint it really is super comftorble. The bed the best we found, the glass door in the bathroom I would imagine would be difficult if you were not staying with a partner but not to bad, the lobby food restaurants sky bar staff and pool area all really nice. Bike and scooter hire available for hire or take the tram into the city which isn't to bad if you can handle a 15 minute trip. In short this is an awesome hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jo B
Reviews.Content: The Fashion Hotel is very easy to find and with only 2 stops max on the train from the airport. Getting into Amsterdam centre is equally as easy, with frequent trams that take 10-15mins. The tram stop is a 5 min walk, but I overheard a member of staff say a new tramstop will be situated right outside the hotel next year. Situated around Vondelpark and Rembrandt Park, the hotel is just outside of the main Amsterdam centre in quiet surroundings. We had a large double room which had loads of space, a flat screen TV and a good sized Bath/shower room. The hotel was always kept to a high standard and the staff were always friendly and helpful. We had breakfast only one morning of our stay as we thought it was expensive at â‚¬15pp and that was only because we were running the marathon that day. Even though we couldn't sample everything due to the run, which then felt very expensive for what we did eat, there was everything you could possibly want for breakfast and it did look amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find, property looks modern and stylish. Despite the hotel being located right on the motorway, our room on the 6th floor was quiet. We liked the large bed, bathroom was good (the glass door to the shower felt strange but did not bother us). Pool was also fine, but you need to take a towel from the room - in the health centre there is shampoo and shower gel but no towels. Parking was convenient and cost â‚¬15 for the stay (relatively cheap by Amsterdam standards) if booked in advance, Wi-Fi available for free without the usual login hassle. The hotel cafe was cozy and reasonably priced. All in all, a very good hotel, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nettersbetter
Reviews.Content: My BF and I got a great deal through Easy Jet holidays for 3 nights here with roundtrip airfare from Belfast for something like Â£275 per person. The hotel is modern and chic with a "fashion theme". The room itself was good-sized and very clean. The window between the bathroom and the room isn't as bad as it sounds. It's a thin horizontal window which is about 5 feet high. Unless someone in the main part of the room is standing directly in front of the window looking in, they can't really see anything. The hotel is a five minute walk to the tram station. The hotel is not located right in the city center, but it only takes about 15 minutes to get there by tram. Next time I'm in Amsterdam, I will probably stay somewhere closer to the city center. I found it a little inconvenient (especially when it was raining) when we would spend the day doing touristy stuff, then had to take the tram back to the hotel to rest/shower, then take the tram back to the city center to have dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunnyCityHopper
Reviews.Content: Verry nice hotel, good price via booking.com just four hours before we arrived. Swimming pool in hotel to relax (only 10 seats around). Verry good breakfast. Minus point: charged 35 euro for 15 hours parking! After complaining, they changed this.

Reviews.Title: “in and out no problems”
Reviews.Author: frenchconnection01
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel, bit noisy in the room from traffic at peak hours -but quieter at night. Bathroom had a strange smell but didn't diffuse into the room, the door of the bathroom is completely transparent so if you share the bedroom you'd better be intimate with the person or else ask them to leave the room when you want to take a shower or bath. Bed was comfortable. Swimming pool was fine, but its the first time I've been asked to take the towels from the room down to the pool - else you had to pay 3;50euros for a towel in the fitness centre, they tell you to dry before leaving the pool area, to go to the changing room to shower but then if you want to take a shower in the centre there are no toiletries so take them down with you too... a bit of a hassle for a quick swim. I suggested to the hotel that they write this information in the room book to save client's time. No time for breakfast, it came with my conference anyway. Wifi was fine and no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Splendid”
Reviews.Author: JustKeepMoving
Reviews.Content: I found the Fashion hotel and booked it on the reviews that it had received on TripAdvisor. I must say that it is one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The service is excellent. The staff of of the best professional standard. The hotel is kept extremely clean, the decor is divine (sorry had to say that) in a word its exceptional. If there is one and only one downfall, that would be that it is not closer to the centre of the city. Even before arriving a member of the Reception Staff (MichaÃ«l van Es whom I cannot praise higly enough) went the extra mile to assist me in making this stay extra special which was a surprise birthday present for my fiance. He organised a spendid reception on behalf of the hotel and even recommended booked and reserved an evening entertainment. I have to say also that my fiance has a disabilty and MichaÃ«l even organised it so that our room was not too far from the lifts .. now how cool is that!!!). Also if you get the opportunity at least have one meal in the restaurant AND visit the Skyy Bar. I highly recommend this hotel. [Ps on the downside was the spa area this was most unfortunately. When we arrived we were met by (I presume) the spa manager, who approached us saying (while wiping his face on a towel) that it was a hygenic area and we could not look around. He also repeated a couple of times that the spa was not part of the hotel and we had to speak to him if we wanted access (the is information in the room and other notices which explaines what is free access i.e. the pool and the gym and what has to be paid for) In fact he was so obnoxious that my partner who needed to use the pool as part of his rehabilitation exercises and another reason for booking the hotel, would not return! The man was AWFUL. Thank goodness they are "not part of the hotel". The spa area looked lovely, the facilities are amazing but the staff could do with a bit of training when it comes to courtesy. I too have worked in a boutique hotel spa and I would NEVER approach or speak to clients in that tone. So word of warning, if you want to use the spa dont expect a great reception, bring your own towel and look out for "Mr Nice Guy!]

Reviews.Title: “our weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great all the staff were very helpfull the skybar was great the guys working up there were great we had a great time with them discussing cocktails they did and even ones they didnt great guys. the food was also very nice only got to breakfast twice in 4 days but thats because the bed was so hard to get out of.the gym and other spa were also great. the best way to get to the city is by tram short walk to the station taxis are also good costing about 15 euro so all in all brilliant stay we will stay here every time we visit amsterdam thankyou to everyone at the hotel you guys are great

Reviews.Title: “very good excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tessa F
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from the 07/10/11 to the 10/11/11 with my partner and the hotel was amazing very clean and tidy the front desk staff were lovely and made our stay very welcoming the bar staff especially Anthony was very helpful and welcoming and kept us entertained at the bar throughout the weekend. the hotel is 15 mins away from centrl station and 10 mins from dam square really close to schipol airport in a taxi 15 mins. Also tram 17 and 1 runs every 10 mins so no problem in travelling to town centre. very clean and sophisticated hotel very classy i loved it and will definately go back .

Reviews.Title: “Got better the longer we were there”
Reviews.Author: HobartResident
Reviews.Content: We got off to a shaky start when the sole evening receptionist ( with 3 others lurking in the office behind) was somewhat officuous in checking four of us in and in our case allocation a room on the 6th floor right outside a cocktail bar. The room had obviously been rejected by someone else because the TV was stil on and it looked liked someone had at least sat on the bed. When we requested a change, a second receptionist was somewhat put out by our request and curt in her response, so much so that I commented that there was a bad vibe and people didn't seem very happy. We were given the choice of another room with twin beds which was quite acceptable. After that everything was excellent. We enjoyed a relaxing drink in the foyer bar with a beautifully friendly hostess and the rooms were excellent. The hotel decor is quite funky and everything nice and clean with a great bathroom and good TV selection. Wifi a little bit fluky late at night, but free of charge. The reception staff in the morning very helpful with directions and info and recommended the 7euro metro pass which we used extensively. On check-out we encountered our receptionist from our check-in and I am pleased to report it was like dealing with a new person. I guess we all have our bad days. One observation I would make is that funky/fashionable hotels cannot use that "uniqueness" as a replacement for courteous service, I think this hotel is much better than that. We were booked on a wotif rate, I hope we weren't given the dud room because of that!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: gulfetto
Reviews.Content: I was driving for business in Nederland and knowing how difficult and expensive was to find parking downtown in Amsterdam I booked this hotel which is located a little bit outside but still not far from th center using public transportation . Clean and confortable room and good staff made my staying very enyoable . The food at the restaurant was also good , only problem was too much time to wait to be served . I will come back again if price will not raise

Reviews.Title: “WestCord Fashion Hotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jedlova
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago. The short walk to the tram stations was not a problem. However the Internet in the hotel was. Only one computer at a time seemed to be working and the staff at reception were not that keen to help. In the end, we were not even able to print off our flight boarding passes for our return journey. On the morning we were leaving, the fire alarm went off about 8am with an announcement in Dutch. Not very helpful for English speaking guests and very worrying at the time. Nice hotel, but needs attention to detail

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for me!”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBelgrado
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally perfect for me. It's on the way from the airport and less then 10 minutes from my office. It nice, clean, modern hotel. Rooms are quite big and well furnished. You have all amenities and free wireless internet with a good signal.
