My first stay was quite short so I didn't had a chance to try other features of the hotel (restaurant, bar etc) but for the sleep and work I'm 100% happy. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: jailbreaker
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, we used bikes to go to the centre, and had a very nice stay. I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: loves2spooge
Reviews.Content: Got a really good value deal on a couple of nights at this hotel in Feb/March 2011. Stayed there with a boyfriend and the room and hotel was faultless. Lovely and clean, friendly staff, great room service. The Skyy Bar was excellent with amazingly friendly staff. Only problem was the location. The nearest tram is a realistic 10min walk away... Which doesn't sound so bad, but when it's freezing cold and very wet outside (which it's going to be in Winter in Amsterdam!) it really seems like it's quite a distance! Saying that, I wouldn't let that put me off staying again - as, for the price, the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: Horia S
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in such a nice city. It is a little bit hard to find because is somewhere on the autoband. It is very nice inside with very cool architecture and shapes. If you want to go to the city center by train it takes you about 10 minutes and from the hotel to the train station another 5 min walk. The rooms are very nice in the same style like the lobby and are very big. The bathroom is great very spacious and has both shower and bath. The spa looks good and has al the things you need to relax. The thing I didn't like was the breakfast. It was 17 euros extra and wasn't nothing near a 4* breakfast. Another thing you need to know is that the parking costs 25 euros/day so that is also pretty expensive. Overall I had a good time at Westcord Fashion Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we want to go back soon!”
Reviews.Author: vershi
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean and friendly hotel Nice bar at the 10th floor but view isnt amazing as facing motorway Tram is about 15min walk from the hotel/ night bus available from the city centre (N 353)-get down at Lelylaan Rooms are medium size but comfortable and luxurious-include both walk in shower and separate bath Hotel had arranged cocktails for my husband's bday which was a very nice touch and made the stay special Free wifi Overall the hotel is very cosmopolitan and deinitely stands its name!

Reviews.Title: “25 euros per day to park for hotel guests!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: looks nice, staff lacked professionalism. Vacuum cleaner left outside a lift and guest fell over it and injured themselves. 15 euros each for 1 cold coffee and a dry croissant. 25 Euros per day to park in the car park despite paying full price for hotel stay. 12 1/2 euro local tax to pay too. Room clean and modern, however be prepared for staff to enter your room unannounced to sort a problem with the tv channels. The bathroom has a clear glass door and male staff saw my wife getting out of the bath when they burst in. no apology. alot of money for very little.

Reviews.Title: “quite unique”
Reviews.Author: cleversod
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in August 2011. The hotel is easy to find, it rather stands out to be honest. Getting there, we took the train to Central Amsterdam Station, with a view to hiring bicycles and then riding to the hotel (it's about 20 min cycle ride). But the bike shop was closed. Take Tram number 1, stops about 200 metres away. The hotel is situated between 2 lovely parks, ideal for runners who are in training, like I am!! The hotel is rather beautiful, not without it's flaws though. The staff are helpful and polite, with the exception of the lady who manages the Gym suite in the basement, she was doing her best to be as unhelpful as possible. Our air conditioning didn't work very well, but that was fixed as soon as we mentioned it. I fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms a little loud”
Reviews.Author: apfelwein
Reviews.Content: We came to Amsterdam for New Year's Eve and booked this hotel as it is very close to where a friend of mine lives. It is just one stop from the airport by train and you can get to the city centre by train or tram. The hotel itself is nice. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Our room faced a very busy streets which you could hear through a closed window. I do not think this would work for me in the summer. A good option if you need to be in this part of town but also easy to get to from the airport an the city centre. There are a couple of restaurants within walking distance but not a big selection. The hotel has a fantastic bar with a great view of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Ramona96
Reviews.Content: The Fashion Hotel is a beautiful hotel near the centre of Amsterdam. The price for a stay is really competitive for Amsterdam, which can be expensive. The rooms are really comfortable, beautifully designed and spacious. You can easily get a tram to the centre in about 15 minutes or it is only about 5 minutes by tram from Leidesplein, a lovely square with lots of pubs, restaurants and shops. The skyy bar at the top of the hotel is worth a visit for the view. I would definetely stay here again if I visit Amsterdam again. The only reason I didn't give a 5 star rating is that the service could be quite slow, the staff are helpful but there could be quite a queue to wait to talk to them and they are more polite than friendly - maybe more staff are needed on the front desk?

Reviews.Title: “better location than expected”
Reviews.Author: glenngj
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nice and big. The bed was wonderfull! The bathroom, with bad and shower, had a glass door but you had enough privacy because the toilet was seperate. Hotel staff was attentive but a bit slow. The location was better than expected. It was out on the outskirts, but the tram stop was a 5-minute walk, with a bike it was easy to find and only 15 minutes and a taxi cost us between 10 and 15 euro's in total. Also we thought that there wouldn't be any parking possibilities unless you had to pay but we found a spot in the street behind the hotel, for free!! The only downside for us was that in the skyybar you couldn't go outside for a smoke and that the pool was overcrowded and the dressingroom wasn't very clean.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: arrosen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 day business trip in Amsterdam, and was fairly happy that I did. The rooms are typically small, but the room I had wasn't too bad. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. It was a bit cramped when I needed to do some work (small desk, very uncomfortable plastic desk chair), but thankfully I didn't need to do too much work from my room. Free wireless was nice, and it was relatively fast. Breakfast was good (sufficient, but not great), and all of the staff were accommodating and pleasant to deal with. The hotel is a bit off of the beat-and-path, but relatively close to a trolley stop, so it is only a few minutes until you are in the heart of Downtown. Given the price, I would likely stay here again if I went back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel shame about the location of tram stop”
Reviews.Author: DrakesterJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights with my wife at the back end of a busines trip. Very nice hotel, smart and stylish. We booked one of the package deals which included room, breakfast, 3 course dinner, cocktails and access to the spa. Everything was great and really good value when compared to other hotels in Amsterdam. On the down side the tram stop is a little too far from the hotel (although the actual tram journey isn't a problem) and there isn't anything in the local area. When you go out you really have to stay out, it's location doesn't really make it a pop back for a couple of hours and then head out again type of place. If you are good with this and want a stylish hotel for half the price of other more centrally located options then it come highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A total headache”
Reviews.Author: gemskibeckley
Reviews.Content: I went to amsterdam with my fiance for valentines day. The hotel was not that easy to get to. As we didnt know the way we got off at the tram stop after the hotel and had to walk through quite poorly lit streets. When we finally got to the hotel. We were greeted with a building site and steep steps to carry our cases up there was a door next to the steps but the was accessed only by a key card. We were given the keys to our room at reception and because we had been travelling a long time desided to take a shower. Only to find that both the shower and the bathroom door were.made out.of clear glass. Even though i was there with my fiance you still expect a.bit of privacy. Every morning we woke up with a head ache i cant say for sure but im sure the air con was blowing in dust from the building site in to our room. We asked at reception if there was a quicker way to the tram and were told to go to the stop before the hotel, eveb tough this was quicker the road works made it difficult to get there easily. We had to go under a dark bridge to cross the.road to get to the tram. Walking back at night was a bit unerving. During our previous visits to amsterdam we have stayed at the.movenpick. It mite be more expensive but we will be going back there. We wouldnt stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Marit87
Reviews.Content: When looking for a great hotel to stay the night my boyfriend and I chose this hotel because of the looks and the price. We could book a room for one night for â‚¬50 excl. breakfast! The staff was friendly and helpful even though at the time of checking in the pin didn't work and I had to put it on my credit card instead of paying with my debit card. The room was clean and beautifully decorated. The only thing I didn't like was the shower (we had booked a room with bath but did not get this) and the bedlinen (too rough). The breakfast was lovely, serving a mainly English breakfast. I would advise this hotel for couples that do not want to go out at nights or have their own transport. The location of the hotel is outside the center making it very difficult to get back at night! (Night bus is available after trams stop running) We had a great stay and maybe will return someday.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: LynnandJane
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at this lovely hotel. It's definitely a 4 star, very smart and looks almost new. Yes it is out of the centre but the trams - nos 1 and 17 are very frequent. The hotel is a 10 min walk from lelylaan station which is the first stop from schipol towards amsterdam centre. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Yes breakfast is extra , if u book it at hotel reception it is 15 euros each. Bed very comfortable. Got a good deal on the Internet. It is a big hotel and coupled with where it is I guess they give good deals to try and fill it . Would recommend mike's bike tours.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed compared to last time”
Reviews.Author: John2550
Reviews.Content: Was the second time I visited the hotel. I was impressed the first time, however, was visiting in a calmer period that time and apparently the busy holiday season results in staff mistakes. Upon arrival, I found a dirty toilet in my room. Toilet had not been properly flushed, there was still toilet paper floating around in it. I also tried to order room service. The lady at room service told me that the food would be up in half an hour. Had to wait for an hour and a half, only to find they had forgotten me (had to call reception myself to figure that out) and the kitchen had been closed by then, so I couldn't get any food anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fitchy_gent
Reviews.Content: Located near the Amsterdam fashion center, and just next to the motorway. pro - comfortable beds - spacious room - swimming pool - bar with outside terrace contra - no sparkling water in minibar, only mineral

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sunni_6
Reviews.Content: We Visit WestCord fashion hotel in Amsterdam on 30Apr11.It happened to be the Queens birthday which is a national holiday. The hotel is very close to the Schiphole international airport .You will need to get a train to Leylaan Station, then tram No1 or No17 for just one stop .It will take you about 15min.The hotel is very modern, the rooms a quiet big, the bed is nice and big as well, staff is nice and helpful .It is little bit off the centre about 15min walk but Amsterdam is not that big town. The hotel is very close to the park. The swimming pool is reasonable size (you ca use it for free if you a guest of the hotel but for the sauna which is nice too you have to pay) and we enjoyed that too. The only thing we did not like is the Sky bar. There was only one person serving all customers, the bar was full ,we wanted to try on some of the cocktails but when we had to stay for half an hour or may be 45min we was not able even to order anything and we left. Maybe all the people came at the same time but they definitely needed more staff at that time. Amsterdam was really nice town. The day when we went all Dutch people going out on the streets dressed up in something orange, the canals a very busy as well ,it is very colourful ,the music is going on the all day and all night so if you prefer a quiet break you might want to pick a different day.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad ...”
Reviews.Author: ThFerret
Reviews.Content: Rooms were OK. Location is on city outskirts - tram trip to city centre is about 15 mins - and it's not a particularly atmospheric neighbourhood. The good aspect of the location is very easy access to motorways if you're driving, as we were. The hotel has a large underground garage too. The pool was good but the men's changing rooms smelled appallingly lavatorial. We didn't eat in the hotel but did have a drink in both bars. We found the service a little slow in both, particularly when we wanted to pay and leave. It was slightly odd that the Skybar was very busy, but the upstairs seating area was kept closed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very good”
Reviews.Author: Peter_S_Hunt
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good stay. The hotel was clean, modern, good value for money and well run, with good food. One slightly disconcerting element was the design of the bathrooms. The door was of clear glass and there was also a window from the bedroom into the bathroom. All very well if youâ€™re a married couple, but more awkward if you have a couple of teenage children of different genders sharing a room. One final reservation was that the top-floor nightclub felt a bit scuzzy, so we didn't go up there in the evening, but we'd readily recommend the rest of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ok but a bit far out”
Reviews.Author: Fungus-feet
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok but it is a little way out of the town centre. Access is fairly easy by tram. There is nothing around the hotel so if you want to just hang out and want something to eat your only choice is hotel food. The room size was ok and the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: chloboat
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time staying at the Westcord fashion hotel, the interior is very funky but not too much, and our room was very spacious. The staff were very welcoming,because we got married last year and this was our first trip since then we were welcomed with roses fruits and pastries, on our last night we had champagne and strawberries, It is worth contacting them beforehand for anything extra you Would like. The sky bar does the best cocktails EVER I highly recommend the porn star(i wasnt too sure about the name but the taste was delicous) It is a short walk to Vondel park which is a great place for a picnic by the lake and not long into the centre by bike/tram. ENJOY! X

Reviews.Title: “modern big comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: lancastrianUk
Reviews.Content: easy to get to from airport. We were very pleased with our choice to stay here. Clean,spacious and very comfy bed. There is a cocktail bar open until 1am on the top floor which we liked a lot. Maybe not convienent if you want a late night in Amsterdam central, last tram back is around midnight. We paid 17 euro + tax for breakfast on top of room rate. To be fair the breakfast was excellent. Just the swimming pool was included in our room rate, not the sauna, and remember to take towel down with you to the pool; they charge for towels in the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: greyfornix
Reviews.Content: We were in doubt whether to rent a room in the center of Amsterdam in a reasonable limits of budget or choose better hotel that is not in the center for the same price. So we chose Fashion Hotel and were very happy with the decision. The access to the center of the city was so simple, by using tram which is near the hotel (even at night there was a night bus) and the hotel was sow much greater that those in the center for the same money. It really made difference in the atmosphere of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service and Super Comfy Beds!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaBarry
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam at 8am with no idea where to go to get to the hotel. A taxi driver quoted us 40 Euros to take us to the hotel, which we felt rather expensive so said no and quite rightly so as now knowing the distance 20 Euros would be acceptable. My partner and I, after asking in the airport information travelled to the hotel via the connections bus which takes you directly to the Fashion Hotel (or any hotel for that matter) for a flat rate of 15.somthing Euros each. The connections point where to book it is located in the airport too. Our check in wasnâ€™t till 3pm and we arrived at the hotel at 10am but we hoped we could leave the luggage there, Michael (not sure how to spell,) greeted us at reception and was ever so helpful. We were able to leave the luggage there and he even sorted it out so we could go to our rooms at around 12am rather than 3pm, which was fantastic! He gave us some advice how to get around and all the staff was friendly and welcoming. To travel from the hotel into main Amsterdam is very easy, the tram is a 5min walk away max 10 if taking a leisurely stroll. (I noticed people saying on here that its further, Iâ€™m assuming they must of walked to the next tram stop down, or have difficulty in walking.) Any way my point is itâ€™s really not far. There is not really much around the hotel area but once on the tram everything is within 20mins max of the hotel. To get around use tram 1 or 17 to central station however tram 1 is much better as it takes you past more areas you are likely to get out for entertainment or restaurants etc. In the evening we went to the bar at the top of the hotel for cocktails, the guy serving was superb and the cocktails were worth the money.. lush! The check out time is 12am, so we went for a quick swim in the pool before we left. It was extra good as it was just us using the pool, but still itâ€™s an ok sized, clean and surprising quite warm! I would defiantly say go for a few lengths in the morning to wake you up! Its and excellent four star hotel, the rooms looked exactly as advertised, the beds were so comfy and we both had the best night sleep! All in all I would defiantly recommend The WestCord Fashion Hotel the only downside is we couldnâ€™t stay for longer!

Reviews.Title: “From from the city madness yet easily accessible”
Reviews.Author: faisalf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easily accessible from city center via a ten minute tram at pretty much all times of the day, not far from the airport and the business parks surrounding it. Check in was alright but rooms could have been better, for example, the bed had a decent mattress but for some reason it was very hard right in the center as if there was wood right under the top sheet. There was a broken electric switch panel right next to the tv. Ironing board was just a metal mesh with a cover on it, almost impossible to use. After a 3 night stay, I checked-out around 11 am and came back in the evening to pick up my bag from the front desk and because I had to catch a long distance flight at night, I had requested if I could take a shower at the wellness center. At the time of check out, the lady at the front desk said I could take a shower at the wellness center in the evening, but when I came back, another man at the desk said this was not possible at all. It was okay had they said so in the morning but accepting once and then refusing the request doesn't go well in terms of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “"We had a marvelous stay in Amsterdam at the WestCord Fashion Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HazirahFatin
Reviews.Content: Wonderful interiors, very good service and very reasonably priced too for a luxury hotel. The hotel is located less than ten minutes away from the tram ride with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. The Check-In process was quick and the staff, fluent in English, were eager to help and managed to communicate well with us. Superb! Definitely worth my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, nice city hotel”
Reviews.Author: CracowDanang
Reviews.Content: The location is central but not in the heart of the city. The hotel is located between highway and city. To get to the center you need about 10-12 min by trams (their stop is very close to available). The area around the hotel is quiet and nice. The staff during my stay here were always friendly and available to all guest with any question. The room was sufficiently large for my need, with a very comfy bed, LCD TV, work desk, modern bathroom with rain shower, coffee/tea making facilities and fridge with bar. The breakfast buffet was here delicious with great choice of things. The hote has also own health center with the pool, fitness center and other facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good bet”
Reviews.Author: IsabelVM
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, extremely comfortable rooms, located in the outskirts of Amsterdam but with direct transpostation to the centre right in front of the main entrance, two tramway lines.

Reviews.Title: “Super stylish hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KayJane
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a group of friends. My overall impressions of the hotel were it really is fabulous, and one of the most stylish that I have ever stayed at. The hotel may not be in the centre of town, but access is really easy with trams running right outside. It was never a problem picking up a taxi, after leaving the nightclubs. The only negatives points were the two nights we ate in the restaurant, my order was forgotten about both times, as the waitress tried to memorise all 6 orders. I think it may have been a better idea just to write the orders down. This was quickly rectified though once it was pointed out, and the food was quickly brought out. The other issue was the glass shower room. No problem if you are staying with your partner, but not ideal staying with friends as I was. Overall though I will definitely choose to stay here again, if I visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel let down by service”
Reviews.Author: tmilsom
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel we tried to check in. This was frustrating as the receptionist told me that she had saved me some money and then went on to tell me that the price was â‚¬300 more than the confirmation I had received. In total the check in process took approx. 40 mins. We had opted for the wellness package that gave us the following inclusive items:- - three course meal in the restaurant - breakfast for two mornings - use of the pool, gym, etc with free towels, etc - free cocktail in the Skky Bar We booked a table for our first night. On arrival the waiter gave us one choice of starter main and dessert. we told him that a choice of one or two options was normal and that considering our experience at check in it was the least they could do. To his credit he came back to the table and gave us three to four choices for which we were happy. At no point on the website were we informed of this. The hotel was very well looked after and in good repair. The rooms were well laid out and were to a very high standard. The hotel was a short (5-10 min) walk from the no. 1 & no. 17 trams into the city centre. the trams took approx. 15 mins to get into the entertainment section of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Service from Staff over Queen's Day”
Reviews.Author: Vicki52
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend decided to come to this hotel while Queen's Day in Amsterdam was on as is was good value for money considering how expensive some hotels were. The festival itself was mental (and may I recommend it!) and I didn't realise until on the day that all trams and taxi's in central Amsterdam were stopped because the crowds are so big. This meant getting around in the city was a little difficult if you don't know your way around. On arrival from the airport, which must have been 15 minutes away by tram (trams 1 and 17 will get you to the hotel - check with the tourist information at the airport to find out the routing) we arrived early at 8am and was told our room would be ready by 12pm so we went around the city to explore. When we came back around 1pm to be told our room still wasn't ready. Reception gave us an alternative room so we could sleep while our proper room was being prepared. Which was a little frustrating as we wouldn't have come back so early if our room wasn't finished. By 3pm all was resolved and we moved into our proper room. The room itself is lovely - really funky decor, comfy bed, nice telly with some English speaking channels - news channels too. The bathroom and bath were really lovely - it had a walk-in shower too which was nice! Breakfast was really expensive at the time of booking but its worth me mentioning that there is no-where nearby to eat so we did decide to book this while at the hotel. The hotel kindly gave us our first morning's breakfast for free (after we explained the room mishap) which was much appreciated. Breakfast was great - and I do recommend booking it as there is a wide choice of cooked breakfast, yoghurt, toast, fruit, croissants, juice, coffee etc so although it might seem pricey - its definitely worth doing. The reception were really helpful - taking our luggage while we were sight-seeing, helping us with our room and getting around the city - they helped us plan our routes and all spoke great English. On Saturday early on, we went to Vondelpark to see the little market stalls set up and buy some orange novelty gear - Queen's Day is all about walking the streets and drinking in the atmosphere - and having some Heineken! So we walked around for a bit - the main areas on Queen's day are: Jordaan, Dam Square, Museumplein, and Nieuwmarkt. Ladies, please note the amount of broken glass that ends up on the floor throughout the day, so don't wear any open-toed shoes. All in all this hotel is fantastic and although I rate it, personally I recommend the Red Light District area for hotels. On my trip to Amsterdam before, I stayed in the Red Light District and it meant I was right in the centre of everything and very close to Central Station. If you are staying at this hotel - you will have a fantastic time and enjoy it. Tips for Queen's Day: Wear Orange!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, comfy room & bed - overpiced food & drink”
Reviews.Author: KiBoosh
Reviews.Content: The Westcord fashion hotel is funky, trendy and cool. As soon as you walk through the doors you know you've picked a good one. The staff are friendly and helpful. Access to the lift, corridors and room is all done with your contactless room key. Upon entering the room the first thing you notice is the modern design. There is a wardrobe with full length mirror and inside it was a relief to find an ironing board and iron. There is a safe concealed inside one of the drawers and you can set your own lock combination. Inside the other drawer we found coffee making facilities and there is also a minibar. The bed is as fabulous to sleep in as it looks the pillows were especially yummy - we wanted to take them home! The bathroom is very clean, it has a sink, walk in shower and separate bath. The door is glass so you can see through but this wasn't a problem for us as a couple. It was nice that the toilet was behind its own little concealed door though so you still have some privacy the toilet was next to the entrance to the room. The room has aircon and huge windows which you can open but only slightly so no chance of a cheeky cigarette. The room also had a flatscreen TV and had 4 UK channels. Thats about it for the room I would give the room 10/10! There are ice dispensers on floors 1-7 so we always brought our own drinks home from town and chilled them with ice - much cheaper than paying for the minibar or getting a drink from the bar or the skyy bar. We decided to try the hotel breakfast on our first morning - it was lovely but not worth the money - I think we paid 17 euros each for it! So the next morning we decided to hop on a tram into town and find somewhere cheaper - alas there was! The tram stop is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel which was handy. We didn't spend much time in the hotel so thats all the information we can really give you - I would recommend this hotel to anyone, but if your funds are limited maybe look into eating and drinking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: easydot
Reviews.Content: The personnel where very friendly and willing to help in anything. I really liked that. The restaurant was fantastic. The decoration in general was very interesting. Using the tram the city center was just 10 minutes away and easy to access.

Reviews.Title: “I guess ok”
Reviews.Author: SonamJaan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not as good as I expected, u couldnt control much of the tempurature inside the room - i to would get hot middle of the night! drilling noise of the construction in the morning started from 8am, Hotel's door is not as accessable as you would expect, Bathroom was beautifuly decorated and it was very clean, bed was comfortable and done properly on a daily base, staff were polite and helpfull, there was a massy smell in the hall way on the lobby that never ended but u get used to it, beautiful lounge & nicel decorated, Hotel is about 15 mins from city cneter. At first we tought being a bit away from city center is ok and worth a bit cheaper rate. would I do that again, NO! We wanted to walk around the city center and then have a nap before going out at night but wouldnt work out unless u get a taxi that would coast ~ $29 each way to city center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Eliza_traveller
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and a lovely experience. It is the second time we had used this hotel and they kept the good service. Very good food in the hotel at reasonable price. Try the cocktails in the sky bar.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room, great hotel, horrible location”
Reviews.Author: RobertJackson78
Reviews.Content: If the location were better, would be a near perfect hotel. Pros - Very secure, donâ€™t think of losing your key - Room was very clean - Very modern hotel - High end room, love the bathroom - Good food and breakfast - Internet is good Cons - Sky Bar is very bad on service and quality - Horrible location, far from anywhere, expect to walk and travel - Spa overpriced and service wasnâ€™t that great

Reviews.Title: “Nice & modern design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kurt_B7
Reviews.Content: I stay regulary at the Fashion Hotel. The main advantages : free wifi, right next to the highway, good breakfast, modern interior (since the hotel is only 2 years-old), very nice rooms, nice rooftop bar with window view on a part of Amsterdam and the inside swimming pool and welness. If you stay, ask for a room away from the street/highway. Especially in the summer you could have a lot of noise when sleeping with the window open. It's a bit away from the City Center which is inconvenient for tourists. You need to take public transport (which is close by the Hotel) to get there. More a business than a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very fashionable, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: DerFritz
Reviews.Content: The hotel ist quite new, the intireur is quite stylish and of modern design. Rooms are als stylish and modern but do not lack any comfort. Bathrooms were clean and offer a bit of luxury on small room. The climate control works fine and could be adjusted or switched off if needed. Two points were a bit negative: The bathroom ventilation was a bit loud and was always running. And - more annoying - the free WLAN was not accessible in the inside room. Only near the door (or on the WC) ...annoying... But no problems in the lobby. Free access to PCs was also possible. My daughter tried pool and fitness rooms and was very pleased of both. We took breakfast only on two of the four days, as we wanted to try some local alternatives. This was no problem. The breakfast buffet offered all you need, nothing extreme exceptional but all food was fresh and everything was provided until the end of the breakfast time(!!!) The location is a bit outside of the city center, good to reach by car. Parking in the hotel garage is quite expensive. Near the hotel is the Vondelpark. Tram station is ~5min walk away and provides excellent connection to the center (every 5-7 min, till midnight or later).

Reviews.Title: “The best city trip ive ever had!!!!LOVLEY HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: snowball29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westcord fashion hotel from the 8/4/2011-10/4/2011 and would liek to say what a lovley and clean hotel this was i work in hotels myself in central london and was far more then pleased with the service at the hotel,the bedrooms are out of this world and we had a large triple room booked for us, we had more then enough space could have easily fitted another person into bedroom! love the glass door to the bathroom! The staff were always on hand to help always smiling and i will be letting everyboby back home know how lovley it was to stay at your hotel. Only one downfall at staying at this hotel you are a little away 10mins to 15mins on tram to city cenetre but we wanted to be away from the noise and the hustle and bustle and the city so for us was perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location could be better, bar service terrible, rooms great”
Reviews.Author: looienaar123
Reviews.Content: Quite a walk to tramstop and city centre - last trams 30 min after midnight... Bar service was terrible, 2 days in row Nice & clean rooms were a plus Parking 25 euro day, which is not clearly mentioned when driving in

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: connected2space
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel quite far in advance to get a better price and was a bit scared to see later the reviews describing some roadworks around the hotel and people complaining it's hard to find etc. I'm glad I didn't cancel my booking as I have absolutely loved this hotel. Amsterdam is not that big and public transport system is well developed, the hotel was easy to reach from Schipol airport - 1 train stop and about 10min walk. The central area of the city is within 15min by tram and the tram stop is about 5min from the hotel, we've never waited for the tram more than a couple of minutes. The truth is the road works are there, but it doesn't look messy and we were not disturbed by the noise as it's all going on in some distance from the hotel. I think it might be difficult for parents with prams as it's up and down the bridge to get to the tram stop but otherwise it's fine. But Amsterdam is for tourists who can walk miles anyway :) The hotel staff was nice and friendly, speaking English (and probably some other languages), during our stay we have asked a few questions and they've been helpful. On arrival we've received welcome info pack, also some magazines were in the room. We had a double room, the room size was good (so much bigger than Paris hotels))), there was a proper sized double bed (hate it when they just move together 2 beds, but that was not the case). There was enough storage space, the room was clean, some international TV channels, everything was working fine. Free WiFi in the room. The bathroom was separated from the room with a glass door, which we liked. There was a sink, bath and a shower in the other corner, toiletries provided and renewed during our stay. Toilet was located away from the sleeping area and has a proper (not glass) door :) Have to mention though there's no fridge in the room. The vending minibar has water/juice/alcohol/chocolate bar selection; also there's a kettle with a free tea/coffee but with the breakfast price so high I'd rather had something in the room. We haven't found much places to eat around the hotel itself and we were not keen to pay 40 euros for a breakfast for 2 in the hotel, so we just had tea&croisant in the morning and were off to the city where we could get whatever we wanted in 15min. We didn't use spa or the swimming pool so can't say anything, the same for the restaurant. The bar on the 10th floor is nice, not too expensive, good selection of cocktails and snacks. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel with its unusual design, good service, cleanness and comfort that we've got there, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ,Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Raycle
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is off the beaten track, but for the price its Amazing. Stylish comfortable great for a romantic break. We found the tram journey to be quick and efficient about 10mins from Dam Square. Swimming pool was small & perfectly formed. Also found to bar menu and room service was very good standard.

Reviews.Title: “The horrorfullst trip ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: neanderix
Reviews.Content: Hello, my name is Chaouki Smaili and i'm the owner from the european biggest photostudios-company in europe. So i know what is service ant what's the best for customers. But i think your hotel doesn't know what's the best. My first stay in your hotel was before 2-3 months: 1.stay - i arrived to your hotel and the service-lady was very unfriendly - first night i sleep in a room what smell very ugly - the day after i ask the reception if i can have a new room - so i became one with a upgrade and do all my stuff in this room. 3 hours later a lady calls me and say "It isn't possible to get this room - so i have to left the room and get a other one. The room that your SERVICEpersonal have given to me, was a room which are smaller, louder (air-condition) and without a bath - i booked the "wellness package"....i think it's a stresspackage! If you want to get the package u musst go to the reception and get for everything a voucher. Is' it not possible to get this information in your System? 2.nd stay before 4 days - in the bathroom very much black long hairs ( i have short hairs) - room is very cold - servicepersonal unfriendly - problems with the voucher because not in the System - Fitness area Personal very unfriendly - Sauna doesn't work at nine in the morning - Restaurant crew very slow (restaurant empty) and make a own Party in the kitchen with champagne ant the guests was still waiting of the food - breakfast is OK...but for this Hotel a little bit to small I think all the people who work there, doesn't want to work. They are unfriendly, not concentrated, loud and very slow. That's my feedback...and i have given you a second chance. I think i warning all my business Partners about this hotel! I'm very angry! Chaouki Smaili

Reviews.Title: “free internet, gym and indoor swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: theos10
Reviews.Content: very clean and friendly excellent buffet breakfast for eur 17 not suitable for disabled persons,as there are a lot of steps and besides they're working in the neiborhood. Nearest trams are 5-8 minutes walk,but they bring you to the center within 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of luxury, out of city centre”
Reviews.Author: CHARBobo
Reviews.Content: We got this on a really good deal and we were impressed. It took about 5 minutes to walk to the tram station from the hotel (number 17) and they were doing road works so it was a little dangerous crossing the road! It took about 20 minutes to reach Dam Square, so we ended up just staying out all day. It would have been nicer to be closer so we could pop back and change etc. Also there is nothing around the hotel like shops or bars. The room was a standard double but it was lovely. The bathroom has a glass door (separate toilet though) which was quite fun really. Lovely place to stay, just a bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - would def go back”
Reviews.Author: tara37
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a great stay at this hotel. I would happily recommend this hotel. We arrived early in the morning and were able to check in straight away which was brilliant. The room was really nice, well decorated and very comfortable. We ate in the hotel and the food was very good - in the bar it was 14 euros for pasta - was good food though. Access to the internet for free in the foyer was really helpful to be able to get directions and opening times etc. The cocktail bar was nice - although not cheap (8-10 euros a drink). The location is a few mins walk to the tram stop. To get into the centre of Amsterdam from there is about 10 mins -a quick ten mins. It was really easy to get to Anne Franks, Dam square, Van Gough from the hotel and it was well worth buying the 48 hour travel card from reception. We didn't end up using the pool - was a shame you had to pay for towels- I would expect that as a free sevice if the hotel has a pool. Staff were very helpful and well informed to help answer any questions. There wasn't much immediately around the hotel but not sure why you would come to Amsterdam to not go into the centre and see the sights! I would happily return to this hotel and was very happy with the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Very Clean, Good Facilities,Too Far from Amsterdam City Centre”
Reviews.Author: liam6913
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from an three night break in Amsterdam and stayed as at the Westcord Fashion Hotel. overall the staff are extremely friendly, helpful and efficent, checking in early isnt a problem and the hotel does warrant its four stars. It is a trendy funky hotel with a difference. The rooms are big spacious and very well decorated. They are fitted with all the mod cons you could want. Breakfast in the hotel is ridiculously expensive so we didnt eat in the hotel. However both the normal and skyy bar are great. The pool and gym is well equipped for a good workout however the staff in the gym were a bit arsy I dont know why?? The hotels main bad point is its distance from the city centre, it takes 20 mins on the tram and is too far. However if you dont mind this the hotel is good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: juejosh
Reviews.Content: Arrived in schiphol for our 8th trip to Amsterdam at approx 10.30am; usually we would take the train from schiphol to Amsterdam, which is very efficient and cheap, but as the fashion hotel is close to lelylaan station with then a tram stop, and having already checked access for my wheelchair, we decided on this occassion to take a taxi from the airport. (Taxi cost 28 euros - and we were given a card for a 20% discount off the return journey). Arrived at the hotel after approx a 10 minute drive and although check-in is not till 3pm we were welcomed and swiftly checked in. Our room was on the 8th floor, and the lift (there were 3) was easily big enough for me in my wheelchair, my husband and our case, plus others. The room was a nice size, large, especially by dutch standards, and as has been said before, has a seperate toilet room, which you find as you enter your room; the room is equiped with a large flat screen tv (BBC1, 2 & 3 and channel 5, plus CBBC, british channels plus cnn and other language programmes) tea/coffee making facilities, in a handy pull out drawer, laptop size safe, (with charger plug built in), mini bar was novel, a sort of vending machine rather than a fridge - very stylish, with cans of coke and heiniken both costin 3.50 euros each - charged to your room, so you dont need to find coins to vend the items. There was ample space to hang / store clothes and the wardrobe also housed a ironing board/iron. There is also a desk area with chair and also 2 comfy chairs. Must not forget the bed - lovely, large and comfortable, as were the pillows, and just as in the hotel photos; we had a great sleep. The bathroom houses the bath, and a seperate shower area, plus sink, and hairdryer. The bath was lovely and deep and quite long - well it would be for me as I am only 1.51! - and yes it is seperated from the main bedroom area by glass door with frosty glass panels which more serve to ensure you know that there is a door there than to preserve modesty - however after 25 years together, this did not bother us, but it might faze others especially if business collegues. The rest of the hotel is very stylish and in keeping with the general ambiance of the hotel. We did not partake in breakfast - prefering to have a lazy lie in (after all we were on holiday) and then an early lunch in the bar. The bar area is nice and seemed to be used by lots of people for business meetings; the staff in the bar are very helpful, polite and attentive however the one problem we did encounter, purely as a wheelchair user, is that the way the bar area is set out, area's that seemed more 'set up' for a cozy 2 people were in the area of high bar stools, which leaves the table inaccessable and your view that of your partner - and everyone elses bottom. This left the only option to sit on a table that was set with large sofa and 3 or 4 other beautiful (and heavy) chairs, one of which we needed to move to be able to sit near each other comfotably. There were a couple of other, still large, tables that would have been more appropriate but at the time they were in use. Some other seats were available but again larger tables and seat lower than my wheelchair. No big deal, just a problem for wheelchair users that most 'style' hotels fail to realise. Bar prices were fair (2.50 e for a coke/ 4.50 for large beer), and our lunch was good value for what we got especially compared to breakfast prices. On day 1 I had an omelette (12euros) and hubby had French onion soup (6 euros) and on our last day we had spaghetti (12 euros) both had too much and left some, but it was delicous. The Pool was nice, decent size for a hotel however for disabled people not so good. My hubby went down to do a recki for us and although there were 2 steps (1 is not very deep so wheels cannot easily be balanced on it) the main problem was that there was no changing facilities for disabled people nor any family/multi sex changing rooms. This was solved by changing in our rooms and paying 4.50 each for use of a bath robe to 'cover up' to get from room to pool and back, and although it is mentioned in the hotel booklet that bathrobes cost 4.50, it isnt mentioned that there is no other way for disabled people to change - other than in public, another cost for disabled people that able bodied need not pay out for, and yet another way we are made to feel like an inconvenience. To add insult to injury, we were told quite forcefully from the grumpy lady that if we did not return the bath robes to them imediatley after taking then to our room we would be charged an additional 60 euros! Once in the pool area, there is a nice seating area, as well as the pool and a shower, and sauras & soleriums - behind other doors - at extra cost. The pool is accessed, as usual by vertical steps into the pool; we have had much practice at getting in and out of pools over the years, so I managed to get in/out with hubbys help in our normal manner, and then walking a few steps with my walkingstick to my chair - parked as near as possible to the pool. Well, our last complaint was that the grumbly lady came and moved my slippers that were placed in the area near my chair so that I didnt slip when getting from pool edge to chair! She needs to do not only a disability awareness course but a customer service course - something that I could not say about any other member of staff from the hotel, so hopefully it is just that the pool is rum by another company, if not she is not the asset the rest of the staff are. We were going to use the restaurant just on our first night, and eat out on our second night, but the food was sooo good on the first we had our second nights meal there too. Yes, it is not cheap - but it is not expensive by any means, and for the amount and quality of food you get, the service and the taste of the food it is well worth the cost. My favorite starter was the jerusalham artichoke cappacino which is served with a mushroom brushetta - every mouthful was so tasty and served to appeal visually also. Hubbys favorite starter was scollops with a hazelnut crust, which I also couldnt risist a taste of too! the steak for maincourse (22 euros) -served with a bowl of fries, side salad and pepper sauce - was so delicous and such large pieces of meat that I left almost half! On our second night, I had monkfish and hubby again had the steak. On the last night we pigged out and also had dessert - hazelnut souffle is to die for (that was hubby choice but I ate most of it and wouldnt give it him back!) The food alone is reason to go back to this hotel. We also, dont say suprise surprise, visited the skky bar on the 10th floor. The panoramic view of the city is a delight and the cocktails are moreish, plenty of alcohol, but so smooth and enjoyable. Again, the service was impecable and very friendly, and we spent a pleasant evening there. It was a tad cool in there, but as more people get in the tempertaure would rise so I guess later at night and at weekends it is not so cool. Cocktails cost 8-10 euros each. The area around the hotel is newly built and the pathways, in places, are stillunder construction, which gave us problems getting out and about, even to the tram stop 250 meters out of the hotel, but this is (a) not the hotels fault, and (b) should be completed in a few months, so should not have any bearing on visiting the hotel, even with the work, there was no noise from it during our stay. The hotel would be convenient for the station, the tram stop is close and is opposite rembrandtpark, with a canal at the rear of the hotel (accessed by lift to -2 and exit from pool area). To get back in to the hotel at this entrance you need your room key, which is also needed to access the lift/stairwells. This is a good security measure, however the fact that we could not get anywhere from the main entrance, meant that as we had checked out, we could not go for a walk and come back for our case which we has left in the luggage room (another good security feature of luggage room is that it is ticketed) because we wouldnt be able to get back in to the hotel or back to reception - having now no key! so we were actually stuck either in the hotel (which we chose - having lunch and a coffee) or else get to the airport 3 hours earlier than earliest check in time. Again a problem that able bodied guest would not encounter - unless they have a baby toddler with a pram/stroller, and hopefully one that will be solved when the work in the vacinity is complete. In summery, we had a lovely stay, the staff from cleaners, to reception, bar to restuarant (with great exception of pool!) were excellent food was delicous and our stay was pleasant and relaxing. I would look forward to returning - possibly when paths around are completed.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews would have you think”
Reviews.Author: jdh70
Reviews.Content: Arrived Schipol 09.00, waited 5 mins for train to Sation nearest hotel. Less than 10 min walk to hotel ( some reviews say to use tram, but it hardly seems worth it ) checked in at 10.00am, room comfortable. Yes there are glass doors to the bathroom, so if on a business trip with others you may want your own room. Toilet is seperate, with no sink to wash your hands, you have to go back to the bathroom for that. We used both the Skyy bar on the 10th floor and the ground floor bar. Both were efficiently staffed and resonably priced. We booked through hotels4u.com and pre purchased breakfast. Other guests have moaned about the egg selection, and I must agree with them. Apart from this the breakfast was superb. We had 1 evening meal in the hotel which was very nice, though a litle expensive. Went swimming, take your room towel with you or they will charge you 3.50 euro for towel rental ( pool is not owned by hotel )We Purchased 48 hour tram passes from the hotel at 11.50 euro each. The walk to the tram stop is 5 - 7 mins on a steady walk. We have visited many many cities over the years, and I must say that the transport system in Amsterdam is brill. We never waited more than 5 mins for a tram either from the hotel stop or in the city back to the hotel. Amsterdam city.. everyone must visit, there is something for everyone. Take the 1 hour canal trip, and ensure you visit Anne Franks house. Bars, Coffee Shops ( if you want to not remember your visit ) eateries of all tastes available as well as a surprisingly large selection of shops. Would recommend this hotel and city for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Gym and Pool Staff need to be more customer friendly”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam6
Reviews.Content: I am an expat, currently living in Amsterdam. I visit this hotel with friends and family quite often as the hotel itself is of a very high standard. However, I have visited the day spa on numerous occasions and each time, the staff have made me feel uncomfortable. We were left waiting at the desk for several minutes while the male staff member fiddled with his computer. He did not welcome us or even thank us/say goodbye to us when we left. Throughout the day, some members of the staff, in particular the gentleman, was very rude and abrupt and lacked manners and was not customer focused. From the day I phoned to make an appointment to the actual day itself, I was given a bad vibe. As a result, I found it very hard to relax there. Its very sad because this is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: RulitaW
Reviews.Content: Normally you have two choices if you travel with a budget that isn't unlimited, simply speaking: you stay in the city center and get a less fashionable hotel, or a bit outside and get more hotel for the money so to speak. I chose the latter and I was SO satisfied with my choice! The West Cord Fashion Hotel in Amsterdam might be considered a bit off, but seriously, it took about 15 minutes to go to the city center (tram No 1 and 17) and that isn't such a big deal, is it? Tram station was close, approx 5 minutes walk (if you not carry tons of luggage of course), and the trams come with just a few minutes in between, even during night, so the ride home was never a problem and you never needed to catch a specific tram in the timetable; just go to the station and a tram will appear within minutes. No need to take a taxi unless youâ€™re extremely tired. The surroundings around the hotel was currently under construction (January 2011) but nothing that disturbed the night sleep or so. Actually, the hotel was very quiet! I didn't hear my neighbors at all. The rooms were absolutely fabulous; spacious, extremely comfortable beds and nice and clean bathroom. There is a glass door to the bathroom (not the toilet though!) and a glass window from the bedroom to the bathroom, which make it very stylish and a bit sexy if you travel as a couple. It also lets daylight into the bath room which is nice. Hotel staff was friendly, I had no problem at all, even though the cards didnâ€™t work all the time, so I needed to get down to the reception again and â€œreinstallâ€� it. The sky bar was neat with good drinks, although a bit expensive (approx 10 â‚¬). The pool and relaxing area was not huge but convenient with a very good tranquil atmosphere. The sauna cost extra, 10 â‚¬ pp, which was a shame though. Overall I had a very nice experience and I will definitely visit this hotel again! Hopefully the surrounding areas will be completed then so the environment outside will be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Cool.”
Reviews.Author: rojsreview
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with a friend for a quick smash and grab raid into Amserdam. Quick G&T on the plane, land into Schipol airport, 15 mins on the train to Leylaan Station, take the tram (no. 1 or 17 ) - you pass the hotel on the right just before you need to get off ( 5 minute tram journey) and you do the 5 minute walk back up the street into a very modern reception - easy. The walking time back from the tram stop once youve been into the town centre probably varies depending on how many "coffees" you've had. Trams run just about every 5 - 10 minutes and it is easy to get into the Dam centre by taking the 1 or 17 tram. The journey takes about 15 minutes or so depending on where you want to get off - buy a travel pass from the hotel reception - 48hr one 11 euros. Taxis into the centre and out cost 20 to 30 euros each way but theres not point unless its late at night after 12 - take the tram, it's fun. The Skybar in the hotel is great, avoid Scottish ladies who give you misinformation about travel logistics and you are onto a winner - eat the peanuts (in an English manner). The hotel rooms are nice, beds are huge and the bathrooms are mildly erotically alternative. Great value for money hotel if you like a bit of an adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: roundtheworld53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for new years. The rooms were fab, nice shower, beds and black out curtains. The hotel is about 7 minute walk from the nearest tram stop which brings you right into the centre of Amsterdam. We got a 48 hour pass for 11 euro at the hotel which was excellent value. The trams run every few minutes right up to half twelve which is great. You can also get a train from the airport, the train stop is about 12 minute walk from the hotel and only a couple of euro. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Only drawback for our stay was that the spa was closed on new years day which would be disappointing for those that wanted to use it. It is about 15 minutes from Amsterdam on the tram but this is more than made up for with the quality of the rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “This is luxury on a budget!!”
Reviews.Author: gaynor_robson
Reviews.Content: The room was stunning - beware the glass fronted bathroom, though, if you are shy!!! Staff were polite and extremely helpful. We wanted to get to the centre of Amsterdam, but have peaceful nights and this was perfect. There is a tram stop not far from the hotel and you can buy an all day ticket from the reception for â‚¬7. The trams are great and you can easily navigate around the city with the map they give you at the hotel. The skybar does the best cocktails ever. We would definately use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good but....”
Reviews.Author: Pierre C
Reviews.Content: My first stay in Amsterdam. The hotel was good with a good staff. The only " small detail " that wasn't top was the situation: 25 minutes of the city center and the first station is about 15 minutes frome the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilsaber
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very chic and I had an amazing time. The rooms are big and very modern, which me and my partner loved especially the wetroom. Although it is a little out of town, the tram stop is a 5-10 minute walk and inexpensive. I liked the tram journey as it is only 15minutes till you get to Centraal station and you get to see parts of Amsterdam you would not normally see as a tourist. I think the breakfast is a little expensive and we would rather go somewhere local anyway. The staff were very helpful and polite, nothing was to much trouble. We asked them for map, directions and to borrow an adapter. They helped with everything with a smile. We got a really good deal with Lastminute

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - Great for couples!”
Reviews.Author: LynnKParker
Reviews.Content: I surprised my partner with a trip to Amsterdam this November for his birthday and wanted to stay somewhere really special. This hotel was just what I had in mind, really fashionable, lovely big rooms, swimming pool and a fantastic breakfast included (my partner in particular loved the waffles and maple syrup they provided for breakfast!). The rooms were to a really high spec and everything looked brand-new. We had a quick look at the Skky bar as well and the views from that height were awesome. The one downside about this hotel would be the location....its situated about 15-20 minutes out of the centre on the tram, and then a short walk across the canal to the hotel, which is a pain with all your luggage. For what we required the hotel for though, it was perfect for us... we got the tram into the centre in the morning after a delicious breakfast, then saw the sights all day and got the last tram home (at about half 12) to an extremely fancy and comfortable hotel (The bed was like sleeping on a marshmallow!). All in all a great trip and a gorgeous hotel...would definately recommend Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “You can live without it!”
Reviews.Author: alexandrasousa
Reviews.Content: The Fashion Hotel is a modern design hotel, located out of the centre of the city despite is quite close. The neighbourhood area is a residential and office area, therefore don't expect restaurants and cafÃ©s. The room is quite modern, big and has lots of closets and selfs, good type of blackouts; while the bathroom is very small but tidy. The service is very very poor: remote and TV are not working properly; TV just has 2 channels in English, beeing all the others Dutch and German; no telephone on side bed; I requested a blanked but the hotel doesn't have (quite impressive!!); the bed cover is extremely hot (when I say extreme is really extreme) so I don't believe somebody is able to use it; just has one type of pillows; the bed wasn't properly done, somebody just pull the bed cover; on the first day internet wasn't available (on the following day front desk wasn't informed about this fail). Food in the restaurant is good but very expensive (23â‚¬ to 29â‚¬ per main dish), breakfast is nice but with few variety, but again in a design room. If this Hotel wants to get business guests if has to put a lot of effort on it, since the service has to improve dramatically, and believe me I'm not that demanding! I don't expect to come back.

Reviews.Title: “good rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: pepela24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3rd time this year and decided to wrote a review as by now it's a consistent picture. Rooms at the hotel are really nice and spacious, with excellent beds. The badroom has glass doors so wouldn't recommend sharing the room with anyone except partner, but otherwise it's good. Downsides are that the internet connection is often poor or not working (and one section of hotel is not covered by the wi-fi so had to change rooms to get connection); the breakfast is really bad. Staff don't clean tables that much and as the restaurant is fairly small, it's always a struggle to find a clean spot to eat. The quality of the breakfast and restaurant in general is decent but the prices are rather high. Hotel is located on the ringroad near an office park, making it unsuitable for tourist but because of the inadequate internet, it's no good for business travellers either. Gym at the hotel is small, but has all standard machines and some free weights.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in our entire trip”
Reviews.Author: MomandDaughter_2010
Reviews.Content: It's not downtown, but just jump on the tram and you are there in 4 stops. After a couple of days, we were very glad we were out of the downtown scene. Extremely clean and nice big rooms. Breakfast was too expensive, but the food was good. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great value for luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shortest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were not dissappointed. The room was large, comfy and of a high standard. The bathroom is ensuite with shower, large bath and washbasin with complinentary shampoo, hand lotion etc. The toilet is separate from the bathroom - bit odd but not a problem. Minibar in room which has space at the bottom to store some of your own things. Large flat screen TV which we could get some English channels on including BBC news. The bed was big and very comfortable. The was no noise from other guests outside the room. The staff were very helpful. We did not book breakfast and did not eat in the restaurant so can't comment on food - but the Skyy bar at the top of the hotel is really fun - the drinks aren't too expensive and the barstaff and mix some great cocktails. There is also a swimming pool and spa in the hotel, we did not try these out due to lack of time and this trip (partner running marathon). The hotel is situated on the outskirts of town, but we found it really easy to get to town via the tram system - the stop Surinameplein is only 5 mins walk from the hotel. Best value on the trams is to get the GVB card for 24/36/72 hours and get on and off trams wherever you want to go. Plus if you travel from the airport via train you can get off at station Lelyaan instead of central station and walk to the hotel (approx 10 to 15mins). We would most definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Littlemissoolia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my 30th birday with my husband in September this year. The hotel is stunning. The public areas are immaculate and modern the room was also gorgeous. The staff were pleasant. We only paid around Â£310 for four nights, which I thought was a total bargin. The hotel is maybe a bit far out for some but we found it fine. We walked into central Amsterdam one of the days, it only too about 35-40mins. It was only 15mins on the tram, which was really frequent. The food in the restaurant was nice and in general reasonably priced, although on some of the dishes the portion size was a little disappointing. The only criticisms I have are: The wi-fi in our room was only accessible in the toilet! The room was also ridiculously warm at night, despite there being air conditioning in the room. Overall though I was really impressed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR THE BUSINESS TRAVELER: NOT SO GREAT FOR THE TOURIST”
Reviews.Author: hurley7th
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully run and appointed businessmen's hotel; by that I do not mean that it is short on style, comfort or luxury-it has all those things and more. Nice athletic facilities with pool and spa, overflowing breakfast buffet and very helpful, friendly multi-lingual staff. Need to send an email-just walk up to the front desk and sign on. It is very pricey even by Euro standards so you can expect to pay E 250-300 per night. As its name indicates, it is in the fashion-garment district, and though there is a tram stop right near the hotel that will take you to the city center for less than 2 euros, there are no tourists sights in the area, nor did I see any available bars or restaurants near the hotel; ladies not traveling with escorts might not feel comfortable leaving the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MiaMonty
Reviews.Content: Get the Deluxe rooms. Small but have everythin u need. Rooms have an en-suite but with a twist. The Walls are frosted glass and Right beside the bed. So not for partners who are not comfortable with each other. Most rooms overlook a small version of a red light but hey if u don't wanna c that sort of thing don't go to Amsterdam. Location - perfect. Rooms are adequate and clean. All together would recommend

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great value, little charm”
Reviews.Author: Antwerp2Dutch
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay- new hotel, clean, spacious rooms, easy access to city center, and the design is interesting. Don't expect a charming boutique hotel, but for us it was really comfortable and functional. The pool is also probably a plus, though we never really got around to seeing it- we came to see the city, not hang around in our swim suits.. If you arrive by car we recommend the parking lot of the World Fashion Center, it's dirt cheap and they even give free tickets to the tram!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...going back this year!”
Reviews.Author: xgirl87x
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in November 2009. It had only just been opened. Gorgeous hotel, very clean, lovely bed and very nice bathroom including a nice deep bath and shower. Didn't eat in the hotel but food looked good. Service was great and the swimming pool was perfect! The location of the hotel is only about 10-15 mins on the tram to the square or 10 mins by taxi which wasnt a problem for us. We liked it so much we have rebooked for this year! Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - great rooms - little to no hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Gemma010
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location ... disappointing service. If you are looking for a clean, beautiful hotel ... WestCord Fashion hits the spot! However, the service offered for the expensive price tag is poor ... we waited 20 minutes for teabags, three days for batteries (for the TV remote control), and were told that milk could be provided for tea at cost of Â£7.50.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: MissThaing
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's a bit out of the way in a weird rubbly part of town. DOESN'T MATTER! For comparison, I will tell you about my and my fiancÃ©'s experience here and at another hotel in the middle of town. The middle of town hotel had the feel of a tourist dump catering to the hoi polloi whereas this hotel feels like a sleek getaway. Every detail is CUTE. :) My fiancÃ© and I are young, urban people in the music industry. Fashion Hotel treated us like special guests, they were kind from the get-go. The hotel in the center whose name I won't mention? I got the feeling they gave us a room off to the side just for the looks of us, asked us if they could see our room keys, and didn't file our special "extra person" fee and in dealing with it, we ended up missing our last opportunity to go to the zoo. Fashion hotel is clean, cute, and SEXY! Well-designed, thoughtful, upscale but inviting. I loved it, and on our second Amsterdam vacation we often woefully thought of it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Style & substance, but not a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: zwerf
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel that provides modern, upscale rooms for a good price. It puts on a good breakfast and has good conference facilities. The main issue is the location. The hotel makes a good first impression. A proper four-star. The reception staff were efficient, helpful and flexible. The dÃ©cor in the hotel is based on â€œfashionâ€�, so I guess you could call it â€œupscale funkyâ€�. Lots of bold colours. We loved the room. Fairly spacious, well lit, modern, new-looking, clean. Big comfortable bed. Interesting fabrics and design. Modern, luxury bathroom, with separate WC. Lots of closet space & counter space. Excellent coffee-making facilities, fridge, ironing board. Our room did not have an interesting v iew, but then we were on a lower floor. Quiet, even though close to the motorway. Free wifi. (A huge factor when choosing a hotel, I find.) The TV had a number of English channels, and channels in other languages. However, the TV had an unusual channel-display system that included an annoying slight delay when changing channels. The breakfast spread was extensive, varied and classy, although not perhaps in the luxury range. Eggs scrambled or boiled. Various sticky buns. OK coffee. Very nice fruit and juices. Itâ€™s not cheap if you order it separately (â‚¬14 I think) so try to get it included. The cuisine produced by the kitchen here, as you might expect from a â€œfashion hotelâ€� is quite good. I had lunch here twice, and it felt positively luxurious. The conference facilities and services are excellent. The fitness centre is more than a typical hotel gym, but less than a proper health club. It has a 15 m pool and a small facility with about 12 expensive-looking cardio and strength machines. These are free for hotel guests. I didnâ€™t see dumbbells or barbells, but maybe theyâ€™re there -- they wouldnâ€™t let me look. The sauna costs â‚¬10. When I was ready to go in to train, I was subjected to an off-putting inspection, lecture and serious attitude. Save yourself the trouble: Bring a clean towel and clean your shoes thoroughly before attempting entry -- and donâ€™t look them in the eyes. Theyâ€™re clearly looking for reasons not to let in the hotel guests. Itâ€™s not an extensive, welcoming facility. There is no other gym nearby, as far as I can see. Indeed, there is almost nothing at all nearby (except the highway). So if working out is important to you, find another hotel. The first thing you notice about the WestCord Fashion Hotel is its location. Itâ€™s in a part of Amsterdam that no-one really goes to. Itâ€™s about 500 metres from something called â€œWorld Fashion Centreâ€�, but that is hardly a site worth a special trip. The parking was a whopping â‚¬25 a night, even though the hotel is located along the motorway in the middle of nowhere. If they are trying to get motorists to stay here, this seems like a strange way to do it. The location is convenient only in the sense that itâ€™s on the A10 northbound near the S106 (Cornelis Lelylaan). So getting here by car from the motorway is not that difficult. Still, the A10 is hardly an â€œopen roadâ€�. The hotel is about 3 kms from the A4/A10 motorway interchange, one of the busiest in the entire country. Come here at rush hour (from Schiphol or anywhere else) and you are certain to be caught in a serious traffic jam. Nor is the hotel particularly close to Schiphol, despite what they tell you. You might think, well, Iâ€™ll park my car at the hotel and take public transport into the centre of town. That is conceivable, because tram 1 and tram 17 do come out this far. However, you have to walk several hundred metres to get to these stops. Surprisingly for Amsterdam, no tram stops beside the hotel. If you plan to come back after a night on the town, you have to rely on Nightbus 353, which stops at Lelylaan Station. From there, itâ€™s about a 500 m. walk to the hotel in what seems to be a relatively safe neighbourhood. I really urge the hotel to issue guests with a sheet of paper with simple and precise instructions on how to get to Amsterdam (and back) by public transport. When we were there, the hotel was filled with Italian bus tourists. There were others, but it was mostly this at breakfast. Somehow this hotel suited this particular group perfectly. This hotel is perfect for motorists who want to stay near Amsterdam, but donâ€™t need to go to the centre of Amsterdam at all. The location didnâ€™t work for me personally. While I would definitely recommend the hotel itself (5/5), I would not recommend its location (1/5). My â€œyesâ€� is therefore a qualified one and my rating tries to balance these two factors.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a real fashion hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SigoSema
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in a clean, modern and easy access hotel on our first trip together to Amsterdam and Westcord Fashion was the right choice. We really liked the photos of the hotel while booking via booking.com and the hotel definetely was no disappointment at all. Such a clean and comfortable room. A great, big bed and two chairs with a coffee table in between could fit in the room. Amenities contain tea/coffee which is definetely a plus. Lobby, bars and other public areas are very fashion and fun. Location is not like in the middle of everything but taking one bus and 10 min trip take you to the heart of the city. If you imagine that you can easily go on foot around Amsterdam, transportation doesnt cost a thing. Staff was good.Helped us with whatever we need. We wanted to book a one day tour from the hotel and they did really good job with that also. One not cool thing about the hotel was the music noise coming from the Sky Bar (I think 11th floor or something) but it was ok after a while because we dropped dead everyday after long hours of discovering Amsterdam. I cant really remember any other bad thing about this hotel. We really enjoyed staying there and recommend to evryone.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of town, but superb value”
Reviews.Author: robfsg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is around 30 minutes from the centre of Amsterdam (5-10 minutes walk, 20 minutes on the tram) but offers unbelievable quality for the price. The rooms are modern, luxurious and spacious. We had a drink in the Skyy [sic] bar, it's OK up there but a little disappointing. Otherwise we brought in supplies from the city everyday (there is a small drawer with a couple of wine bottle sized compartments for your own use as part of the mini bar). There is a large Albert Heijn supermarket, next to Magna Plaza and near the tram stop at Dam Square for both lines 1 and 17 (that go to the hotel) so this is ideal. The nearest tram stop is Derkinderenstraat, not Surinameplein as others have said. You need to exit the hotel on level -2 and then turn left, under the motorway bridge and then right at the roundabout. The tram entrances are under the next bridge on the left-hand side

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: CamberleyCarrot
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel and is excellent value for money for Amsterdam. The rooms are a good size and were very clean. The hotel is a bit out of town with nothing much in the local area but the tram stop is only 10 minutes walk away with the tram ride around 10 minutes into the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “very new and clean and huge rooms with really low price”
Reviews.Author: AYFERS
Reviews.Content: It is really good hotel with this best price. The room was huge for an Amsterdam city hotel. I will stay in this hotel if they continue offer this price. It is close the city center with clean and cozy decoreted rooms. I stayed a lot of Amsterdam hotels in different areaz but this is the best one..

Reviews.Title: “Nice but on the periphery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with very new feel. Nice pool; ok service; EXCELLENT breakfast. Too far from city for my liking (or at least the local tram stop)- it cost â‚¬15 to get a taxi to the hotel from Liedensplein on Friday night! If you needed to stay near the airport or the main motorways ( or didn't need to be central) this is a brilliant choic. Of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Luxurious Hotel, would highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_Aug1981
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel last weekend and had a great time!
