The location may not be very central but the city centre is easily accesible by tram and travelling on public transport adds to the tourist experience! The hotel itself is beautiful, very stylish and elegant and definately matches up to the photos. The room is spacious enough for two people and the beds are comfortable. I can understand people being wary of the window into the bathroom/shower though, however you soon get used to it! I would recommend visiting the SKY BAR for cocktails and a 10 Storey View, the cocktails are lovely if not exactly cheap! We had breakfast and bar snacks in the hotel and the food is great. The staff are courteous and helpful, they recommended places to go and eat in town, and also gave us tram number and directions. We also made a visit to the Salon for beauty treatments and the Beauty Therapist was friendly, chatty and the treatments were excellent! On the downside, there was a fire alarm at 1.30am on the last night of our stay. I would not call the way the hotel staff dealt with this professional. We ended up waiting outside the hotel until 4am, the fire service was not called and no explanation was given. however, I would call this the only negative part of our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam, we got a fantastic last minute deal at Expedia and it was well worth the money. If you don't mind not being right in the city centre, but would like a comfortable, elegant experience, this may be the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - recommended”
Reviews.Author: EuroSong
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is located to the South-West of the city centre - but still within the city. By London standards, it is still very central: the tram ride takes about 10-15 minutes to get into the centre. The tram stop is Surinameplein, and it's on lines 1 or 17. #1 is the fastest route. It takes about 5 minutes to walk from the hotel to Surinameplein. Rooms: The hotel is entirely non-smoking, which is brilliant in a country like the Nertherlands. The rooms are spotlessly clean and modern. The bed is very comfortable, and the air conditioning works well and quietly. Bathroom: The bathroom is modern, and has a bath and a separate shower area. The dividing door between the bathroom and the main room is made of sliding glass - so it's fine if two people are sharing who are intimately acquainted, but it would be less suitable for two friends on holiday. The toilet is entirely separate, and has a solid door. Check-in: We arrived early in the morning - around 09:30 - and since the hotel was not full they did not make any issue, or even mention the fact that we had arrived several hours early. Check-in was friendly and efficient, and the room was ready immediately. Breakfast: There is a fair selection for the breakfast, but it is not excellent. There is no egg/omelette station, but there is a supply of scrambled and boiled eggs. There is fresh fruit, cereal, bread and cold cuts. There are also fried products, including low-quality sausages. Facilities: The advertised free wi-fi throughout the hotel was not working. The network could be found, but when a connection was attempted it failed every time within the rooms - and only in the lobby it was possible to connect. Even then, the connection was very unstable, and standing next to the router it still failed every time a few seconds after connecting. There were two computers in the lobby with internet access which were free to use for guests. The swimming pool is free for guests to use, but the sauna and steam room are not. The pool area had a rule whereby guests were not allowed to walk in outdoor shoes - and the area outside the door to the pool had a rule wherey guests were not allowed to walk in bare feet. A normal policy, yes - but the problem is that the changing rooms are entirely separate, with no direct access from the changing room to the pool. This meant that - in order to comply with their regulations - after using the pool it was necessary to stand precisely on the threshold of the door between the pool area and the dry reception area, and hop on one leg with the door open while drying the other foot with a towel in order to change into one's shoes. No other combination of action or location would have satisfied them that we complied with their rules. This needs to be reviewed! General comments: The hotel is very nice, but it is understaffed. During breakfast, there were no clean tables available - and the reason was because there was only one girl serving, whose job it was to book in guests, clean tables and re-set them - among other things. We had to clear a table ourselves and then look for hard-to-find clean cutlery. The girl was rushed off her feet: not her fault, it's just that they needed more staff. Overall: We paid under Â£100 per night for two people, and compared with the advertised rack rate of â‚¬245 per night it was great value. The important things were excellent: rooms and cleanliness. Therefore I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that matches the stars”
Reviews.Author: Pyrres
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in the hotel for six days and were very happy with the hotel. The hotel itself was worth the money. I have been in many five star hotels that have been much worse. The hotel was located about 4-5km from the Central station. There are two trams that go straight to there in about 20minutes. Lelyaan station with metro, train and tramstops is also near so it is easy to trip from airport and back. It is easy to get everywhere from there. So we quite liked it compared to hotels in the city center. There are also two big parks close, the Rembrant park and the Vonderpark. The rooms were just like in the pictures. They were modern, clean and nice to stay. The beds were excelent. There were a few problems too, parts of the room were not that well built but those were minor details. Service was excelent for us, but service did depend on the person. The Skyy bar was nice, a bit empty always but stil nice place to go and get a few drinks. The hotel is worth your money atleast for now because they are building more stuff around it so I think that when it is finished itÂ´s prices will go up.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but a bit Far Out”
Reviews.Author: dnadiana
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my trip where I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The hotel itself is very modern and the room decor is all very nice and contemporary. Having said that, only negative thing I can say is that my room was not as clean as I expected it to be. When I got to my room there were several white stains next to the bed and more stains in the separate toilet- I was really disappointed. Apart from that, rooms were comfortable. As far as the cafe/restaurant goes, this was all fairly average. I thought that prices at the restaurant were on the expensive side. The Skyy bar on the 10th floor was funky with decent cocktails but fairly quiet. In terms of location, the hotel itself is located just outside the city centre which takes 20mins on a tram (no.1/17) to central station (closest tram station is called surinameplein and it's a 10min walk from the hotel). I thought the hotel was just a bit far out and I wasn't particularly comfortable walking alone at nights to the hotel as a solo traveller. The closest grocery store from the hotel is in Lelylaan station which is a good 15-20 minute walk. Overall, my stay at this hotel was a fairly average experience. If you like staying at a good value for money hotel but wouldn't mind compromising on the location then this is not a bad place to stay at. Otherwise, I'd pay a bit more and stay at a hotel that is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good choice- some helpful info”
Reviews.Author: Too_Much_TM
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive comments regarding this hotel - it was extremely comfortable. Staff very courteous and helpful- and they let us check in by 11am which was fantastic! The only downside was that they are so close to the airport but have no shuttles - they said they are working on it so hopefully soon The tram/bus/metro [Lelylaan] is at least a 10 min walk away so bear that in mind There is just a shower, no bath but thats ok for a short stay. The glass bathroom door is fine, makes no difference! The mini fridge is really a little drawer, but for 2 days you can manage. We didnt have the breakfast (17 euros), and had tea in our room- but apparently the room service for breakfast is free I think -so a nice treat! They had great offers at the wellness centre- massages and back scrubs for 40 euros etc, so worth a try Lastly, regarding location - it is just on the ring around Amsterdam, and definitley not in city centre. But city centre is 15 mins away on tram and really wasnt an issue for us. We got this hotel on an amazing special (Â£100/night) and had no issue comprimising a little on location - but really 15 mins is no biggie and we spent all day out anyway! Best part was FREE wifi!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bam49
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, very comfortable. just one issue - i dont really need an audience when I am having a bath....!! glass doors are a bad idea! as is the window through to the bathroom...the tram is not too far from the hotel, but its not an area that i would want to walk alone at night. On the last day i took the tram to the station to go to the airport, only to find that it was taped off with plastic police type tape!! had to take two shuttle buses to get to the airport...

Reviews.Title: “Good, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: AntheaNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We didn't have much trouble finding this hotel - thanks to the directions given by other reviewers! (and some very helpful Amsterdammers). It only takes about 15 minutes to get there by train and tram. The hotel is almost brand new and the interior is very modern and fashionable. The room was very clean and we had a huge bed. I wasn't impressed that the bathroom had a see-through window, though?!? The toilet was also separate. (Thank goodness, but why???). Our room faced the road and the traffic from the road was quite noisy which sometimes made it difficult to sleep. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. We were very pleased that we were able to leave our luggage behind the desk before we checked in and after we checked out to save us carrying them around town. Breakfast was good, but the tables were not always cleared away. We ate at the hotel two nights. The first night we were kept waiting a very long time for our food. However, when it came it was worth waiting for. The waiter then apologised for our wait, told us it was because of a party, and gave us a free dessert. (which was also delicious). We enjoyed the meal so much we went back the next night. This time, we were kept waiting again. Also, I asked for my steak to be medium to well done and it came out red and dripping with blood, which I wasn't so happy about. The Skyy bar on the tenth floor was very nice and you have a good view of the surrounding area (which isn't very pretty, but looks good at night!). We were a bit hesitant about booking this hotel because it was out of town. However, it is only about 5 minutes walk to a tram (along a main road and past a building site) and then about a 10 minute journey into the centre of Amsterdam. This wasn't really a problem for us, but I wouldn't recommend it for elderly people or those who can't walk very far. I would recommend this hotel to other people and would choose to stay there again (as long as it didn't get too much more expensive) as it was very clean and modern and it was easy to get to the town or the airport from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Davina7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with another couple stayed a the Westcord last weekend for 3 nights. We found the hotel to be clean and the rooms to be large. A few points to mention are there are no drawers in the bedroom which is a bit of a pain. The door to the bathroom is clear glass so if you are staying with a friend they can see you showering. The toilet however is in another place so that bit is OK. The towels are minute. Free Wi-fi is great. The reception staff are OK but could do with more people and they could be a bit friendlier. The breakfast is a good selection but not enough waiting staff during breakfast so the tables are not that clean if you arrive late. The bar on the 10th floor does great cocktails. It is about 20 mins from the centre of town by tram.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money - Great Rooms - Great Breakfast - Bargain”
Reviews.Author: MMartin247
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for Christmas, the journey from the station to the hotel was treacherous due to the recent snow and took us about 30 mins walk not a great start, also no taxis outside station so be warned. The hotel interior is very stylish and modern, reception staff checked us in early with no fuss nearly 2 hours before we were expected which was relief after that walk. The rooms are very modern and stylish, pictures on the hotel website don't do it justice, plenty of multi lingual channels on lcd tv to keep you happy if thats your thing. You should visit the bar on the top floor a little pricey but you do get a grat veiw of the surroundings at night. Journey to amsterdam centre is about 10-15 mins from the hotel on a tram, (5 min walk to tram stop even in the snow), purchase a travel card from reception this will save you some pennies and make sure you swipe when getting on/off tram or it could invalidate your pass, so we were told. Now the buffet breakfast is to die for, this was included in our stay very filling and some thing for everyone, try the waffles and pancakes...Mmm Now a word of warning if you get a little peckish while in town around the corner from the britiish bulldog about a minute walk on the left is restraunt offering all you eat ribs avoid like the plague we found the staff very rude and the food sub standard in our opinion. Apart from that great hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay but too far out of town”
Reviews.Author: missnicy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and great value, but if you are the kind of person who spends most of your time out of the hotel and is going to be heading home later at night then this may not be an ideal place for you to stay. You have a 5 min walk to the closest tram station, then about a 25 min tram ride in to town. If PT is not your thing the cab fare is pretty expensive - we ended up catching a cab home every night... Also, the hotel surrounds are very dull - there is nothing to do and no local shops nearby to pick up essentials etc. Rooms were very nice and clean - only problem we found was that water ends up all over the bathroom floor as there is no catchment for the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very NEW!!! But I liked it for a business stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DepDawg
Reviews.Content: The hotel it so new that the block its on it still being finished. There was no disturbing construction though when I was there. The hotel is literally brand news, which makes for a nice comfortable stay, and some snags - eg shower didn't drain away properly. It you get there before people come home from work who live in the apartments on the same block, at the time of writing (March 2010) you can park free on the street at night and avoid the hotels 30 euro parking fee. Reception said that the city is introducing street parking in the future.... The hotel is next to the Amsterdam Ring but faces in to a new courtyard and over to the park. Its not a destination hotel but its not meant to be. Pool and gym looked nice - I would use them next time know I know they are there. Comfortable, reasonably priced and free WIFI included. Good for a business stay. Would go back but not for leisure stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, very clean and modern, breakfast was brilliant cant fault!”
Reviews.Author: durbidl
Reviews.Content: The westcord fashion hotel is located on the overtoom road just by the ring road. There is a tram stop about 5 min walk from the hotel, the tram takes roughly 8-10 mins to leidseplein and a further 5 mins to Dam square and central station. The hotel was very clean and modern, the buffett breakfast was very nice. rooms are very spacious with good facilities, the rooms are a little dark and can sometimes be a bit cold. Taxi to leidseplein is 10 Euros but if you are coming back late in the evening can be anything from 15 - 20 Euros. All the trams stop at 12.30 am but there is a night bus back to the tram stop nearly to the hotel. Location isnt great but the hotel was brilliant and would not be a problem to commute for young couples and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Scrummy breakfast, immaculate room”
Reviews.Author: Nicola123Somerset
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fashion hotel for 1 night as part of a b.a. deal. The hotel is quite an ugly skyscrapper, next to an industrial area. Opposite is the world fashion centre, with a lake and park. 5-10 minutes walk from nearest tram. The hotel room was large, with seperate loo and bathroom. The shower was a wet room. The room was well presented, modern and was definately one of the best rooms I had stayed in for some time. There is a swimming pool in Basement - not big enough to do laps in, but fine to relax in. Shame no jaccuzzi! Breakfast was excellent - choice of large sweet waffles, good English breakfast, moist croissants, real orange juice and different types of coffee (mocha etc). Definately worth going a bit further out for the room and breakfast! Nic

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you don't mind travelling into town, DO NOT EAT HERE”
Reviews.Author: WanderlandUk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when me and my parter went over for his works Christmas fuction and found it most unsatisfactory. We arrived after a very early flight and our rooms were not ready so were told to wait in an unsypathetic and rude manner by the receptionist. When we finally did get into our room the bath was covered in a thick layer of dust. That evening we had dinner with about 30 other people for a set meal. I am a pescetarian and when presented with VEAL for the main I was a little cross. But when, after I'd sent it back to be replaced, it was then returned in front of me having been 'well done' I was furious. I sent it back again and was then presented with a plate just full of vegetables which I immediately send back a third time. I eventually got my correct meal which consisted of a tasteless piece of cold salmon resting on a bed of unrecognisable vegetables swimming in oil. Others around me eating the veal also complained that their meat was cold. We were then charged 55 euros a head for an appauling 4 course meal. The location is not that great either as its about 20-30 minutes out of the centre of town on the tram and is on a busy main road. I also find the decor throughout rather offensive to my taste.

Reviews.Title: “an absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: claireb1981
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel as a package with easyjet for Â£140 each for the two nights! i was dubious because i knew that the hotel was a little out of town! we had trouble initially finding the hotel! it is on the 1 or 17 tram lines at surinameplane!! The hotel itself was gorgeous, the room was big and spacious! although not sure what the glass door to the bathroom was all about ( the toilet is seperate!) There is a flatscreen tv with some english channels! In the basement there is a small pool which was empty when i used it, there is also a gym! The breakfast was really good, buffet style and loads to choose from, fruit, cereal, cheese and meat, breads and cooked breakfast! for the price this hotel was an absolute bargain and we had a fantastic time, would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Ugly Design, Miles from Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: islandcity
Reviews.Content: There are so many design elements in this hotel jostling for your eye that you realise that someone with no taste ordered one of everything from a catalogue of design classics; it is so overdesigned that it is kitsch, and not in a good way. Located miles from the city centre, don't get a cab or it'll cost you a small mortgage. A 10 minute walk to the tram stop, then 15 minutes on the tram into the city centre. Nice pool, and gym included in the price though.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel - good standing but off center and average service”
Reviews.Author: Jarimba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at most 1 year old so of course all is brand new, clean and spotless. Overall good standing with modern room. There s a trendy bar on the 10th floor which is also worth a look. On the down side I thought the service was a bit neglected - they forgot my meal order once, they took ages to bring the bill. At reception the girl didn t really speak English (probably the only person in Holland not to speak English)

Reviews.Title: “Great trip!”
Reviews.Author: helliams
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely lovely and I would definitely recommend it. It was quirky and trendy. Our room was immaculate and spacious with a lovely comfortable bed! We paid for bed and breakfast. The breakfast was lovely with lots of choice on offer e.g. cereal, fruit, pastries, full fry up etc. They also even had proper English breakfast tea! The hotel itself is not in the centre of Amsterdam so be prepared to travel if you decide to stay here. It is only about 10 minutes on the tram (with approx 5 minute walk from the hotel to the tram stop). Trams run frequently so we did not find the travel a problem - if you are travelling into Amsterdam you need to make sure you get tram 1. As a whole Amsterdam was great fun although I did find it expensive. If you like to go to bars for a drink be prepared to pay. Me and my husband generally ordered a pint of beer and a small glass of wine which usually came to around 10 euros, therefore noticeably more expensive than at home. Taxis are also expensive so try to use public transport (you can buy tram tickets to last the duration of your stay). We had to pay for a taxi to the airport and this cost 33 euros even though it was only a 10 minute drive! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel even though it is a little outside the centre. We had fun finding our own way around (which was easy!) so don't let that out you off!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again - but shame about the drainage, and people who run the gym”
Reviews.Author: Suz60
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel and I'll stay there again. There are a couple of reservations, namely: * the drainage in the bathrooms could be improved. I had to move rooms because I drained the bath and so caused the room to stink of sewage, and then the room I was in almost had the same problem (to address it, I made the water run more slowly and it drained away safely). * the people who run the gym can be quite rude. They closed the gym five minutes early one night - telling myself and the other person in there to finish up right away. I finished doing my stretches to finish (which take a set amount of time... and which I'd been working towards) and was about to leave (when it was still two minutes before closing time) when they turned the lights off while I was still in there. The woman also gave me a sarcastic goodbye. I complained to reception. * The sauna and solarium aren't included in the price; but the gym and swimming pool are. Other than these points, I was very happy with my stay. The room was very well sound-insulated, kept clean, and was comfortable. Also free wifi. My stay was during low season, however, and I'm sure the price will become unaffordable for me normally. I'll happily stay there again at the right price, but just hope they have a spare room (or two... I had to move once at first when they tried to put me in a twin rather than double as well!), else the drainage issues could become a real problem. It's only 20 minutes into Amsterdam Centraal by 2 possible trams. These run very regularly. And about 25 euros by taxi from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, Modern, Cool, Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunkyYoungLovesTrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on a 2for1 offer with Last Minute. The Hotel was perfect - the room was really lovely - so clean and modern. (the bathrooms are the seethrough modern ones but the toilet is a separate room!) Shower is lovely! Funky Bar on the top floor and a lovely bar on the ground floor. It didn't matter to us in the slightest but the area around is not a pretty area - there is nothing around the hotel you do need to get the tram in and around the place. I gave the location a 4 out of 5 because it took 45 minutes to walk from right in the centre to the hotel (not at a snails pace either). There is a Tram stop 5 mins from the hotel and the tram takes 10 minutes to get you to the heart of it all. It cost â‚¬25 from the airport to the hotel in a taxi. Tram journeys are â‚¬2.60. If you fancy a different sort of night, go to The Supper Club.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, wonderful hotel. Staff was so helpful for us.”
Reviews.Author: pull4ud
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal for this hotel, and even though the location was far, booked it. Quick overview: Pros: Beautiful, immaculate rooms; helpful staff; nice shower and tub; fridge Cons: far from city center; tough getting to hotel from tram stop Pros FAR outweigh cons here. We were immediately impressed at check in. We were prepared to take the steps, so no big deal. if you know it's coming, you can't get upset about it. Staff was very friendly on check-in. Told us they were going to help coordinate our lost luggage (from Belgium) and help get it here -- without us even asking. They later helped us get the luggage back (thank GOD! we had no phone to reach American Airlines). The room was amazing. Just beautiful. It was very trendy and ultra modern. BY far the best place we stayed in Europe in our 17 day whirlwind tour. Bed was comfy, chairs were great, view was neat. really liked the bathroom, but we're married -- might have been strange for friends travelling -- it's a see-thru door. Shower and tub were nice. My husband LOVED the tub. It's huge! Great after a long day of walking. I used the shower and set up a barracade of towels... I knew the flood would happen otherwise. Just set up a few towels and there won't be a big mess as people described. Tons of storage room was welcomed especially since we were excited to go through our luggage after it was missing 4 days after our arrival. Anyway, all-in-all, a wonderful place. Just be sure how to get there, it's confusing!! We actually went an illegal way to get to the hotel... i don't think pedestrians were supposed to go the way we did. I think you're supposed to go under the freeway overpass, but it took a while to walk!

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Theft from Room with No Compensation Provided!!!”
Reviews.Author: UsaMusicalmind
Reviews.Content: During my five day stay at the Amsterdam Fashion Hotel, two large parcels were stolen from my room containing vital medications (including controlled substances for my chronic pain condition that could not be replaced without my regular doctor and vital medical records), cosmetic products, and other personal effects totaling almost 300 Euros in value. Naturally, I was upset due to the fact that I would be traveling in Europe for six weeks and was only at the beginning of my trip. Upon hearing the news, the management assured me the matter would be dealt with appropriately. They asked me to send bank statements to prove the value of as many items as I could, and after hours of work I had finally compiled the e-mail. I never heard back from them, despite calling every day for weeks and subsequently contacting the police. I must have spent almost as much money as I was owed in international cellular phone calls! Silly I know, but at some point it became a matter of principle. Hotel manager was curiously never available when I called, and always had an excuse ready for the employees as to why he could not come to the phone. Very shady business practices. Stay elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm a germ freak and this hotel Rocks! just book it!”
Reviews.Author: FlyFarAway
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were traveling to Amsterdam for vacation. We stayed the first leg of our trip at the Fashion Hotel and it was Awesome!! The rooms are big, clean, very modern, and the bathrooms are cool. The staff were all friendly, professional, and willing to assist. Even when we were less than sober and asked them where we could order a pizza from in the middle of the night!! They ordered us one :) I will admit I'm glad my friend and I booked seperate rooms because the bathrooms are designed to be cool/sexy/chic and the toilet in my room was private but the shower was surrounded by glass walls on each side. Since I stayed alone I didn't care, i thought it was cool. Unless you're staying with a significant other, you may want to request a room with a private shower. The bathroom was kept very clean with fun soaps and lotions in the shower. The Skyy bar on the 10th floor was really great. Friendly staff and excellent cocktails. Part of the ceiling is made of draped crystal. It's beautiful. The bartender was very talented, i felt like i was in Las Vegas. We got a snack at the hotel bar and the food was ok. I had a club sandwich. It hit the spot but we weren't really interested in eating there. The tram is a short walk (maybe 5 mins but i walk fast so it didn't even take that long) to get to the city center. This hotel is well worth the money to stay and I am admittedly hard to please. It was great and i had a blast at this hotel. Since I spent most of my spare time at the kyy bar I never used the pool, spa, or fitness center. I highly recommend the Fashion Hotel Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: pindi
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel - we got the shuttlebus from eindhoven - took 2 hours to reach central station, then got a tram, numbers 1 or 17, and got off at surienemplan which is easier as you walk straight down the main road towards the direction of the tram, and the hotel is right there on your left after a bout 4 or 5 minutes.Staff were very friendly apart from the lady in the wellness centre, but nothing major. Pool warm enough and not busy. Hotel in new condition - and rooms absolute heaven - best nights sleep in ages in a most comfortable bed, light fluffy duvet and pillows, and HDMI tv with Film channel on channel 10 showibg 24 hr decent newish films, and BBC1! Seriously relaxing rain shower, beautiful room and bathroom - glass door to bathroom really nice touch. Tea and coffee facilities, minibar - just paradise Good idea to go to the tourist office as soon as you arrive in central station, which is situated near the east entrance to the station - just follow theh signs. take a tciket and then the staff there who are really pleasant will tell you everything you need to know. worth buying a city map. We did this first, then fit in a city cruise with Lovers, costing 12 euro, which lasted 75 mins and was great, before getting the tram and checking into our hotel at 3pm. Single tram journeys cost 2 euro so worht buying a travell pass - a 24 hour pass cost us 11.5 euro each and was well worth it becasue this hoterl is 20 minutes out of the centre, so need to jump in on no 1 or 17 tram to go out for dinner - we went one night to central station for dinner, and the next to the entertainment district which is in the same direction, half way between the hotel and central stattion, called Lides???? - outdoor icerink - lloks lovely. Amsteram is expensive but there are ;places to eat to match all pockets. The hotel was probably the best we have stayed in and we have stayed in loads - it's only 20 mins by tram to the centre and thr trams are really really frequent and reliable. Amazing hotel, amazing friendly city, easy to navigate - would defo return.

Reviews.Title: “Where are we”
Reviews.Author: Oldbritsabroad
Reviews.Content: I organised a trip to this hotel with a group of 40 friends. Obviously it has just opened and the pavements and gardens have not. Situated on the ring road so 20 mins by tram to centrum. Very nice hotel rooms. Only one small bar nearby so its hotel or a tram ride in for food and drink. Breakfast is included and is good but on cold plates. Meals and drink are astromical at hotel Cheese and ham omlette and chips 17euros.Still we got it at a great rate and we will never be able to afford it when its in full swing. Amsterdam was great but so expensive even compared to other parts of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, staff have lots to learn”
Reviews.Author: Kuprasm
Reviews.Content: Service: Personnel have lots to learn. Only juniors are employed. The owners must seriously rethink what they want with these hotel in the future. Personnel are very kind and politely but they make all the time little mistakes. It is almost funny. Room: Great beds and pillows, only a minor bathroom problem Location: Only ten minutes walking to the public transportation and then ten minutes to the hot spots. Best & Least: Value for the money. Always take i Love Amsterdam package. Free public transportation, many free entrances to the muse a. Hotel is just few months open with some minor start up problems.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to the Westcord Fashion Hotel like may others through Lastminute's top secret hotels. Yes there are teething problems but on the whole we loved the hotel and it made for a really relaxing break. The rooms are really comfortable- the beds are particularly huge and comfortable. Bathroom is lovely, with a seperate shower and deep bath. Yes there is a bit of an issue with the floor but if you dont have the shower on full its ok. All the usual extras were provided- toiletteries, tea and coffee, safe, tv, hairdryer. We didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment on the food, although it was more pricey than going out into the city centre. Breakfast is 17.50 euros and meals were around 30. WE paid between 8 and 12 for breakfast in the city. Drinks semed expensive but on reflection, no more so than nice places in town. I guess the exchange rate is to blame rather than high prices. The Sky Bar is a must for a relaxing drink after trecking about all day. I can recommend the pool and treatments if you fancy a relax although be prepared to pay 10 Euros to use the sauna and steam room. They are also opeining it up to membership so be prepared for it to get busier. The gym isnt up to much although maybe its not finished. Transport to/from the airport is easy, as are trams. You can walk to the Leylaan station from the hotel- takes about 10 minutes. We had problems buying a ticket at Leylaan to the airport- there is a machine but it only takes coins. It wouldnt take our cards so we had to travel without a ticket. We bought a 72 hour tram ticket which was handy. Ride to town is about 20 minutes. There was a problem with the trams one night so we had to get a taxi back which cost about 10 euros. We found lots of places to eat and drink in the centre- either we were lucky or everywhere is a really high standard. Id really recommend the 1st class restaurant at the central station for a real step back in time- i promise you wont be disapointed. We did find the access to museums and churches a bit pricey- everything seems to cost so much so in the end we didnt bother.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jennyd60
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel after seeing a special offer on one of the popular travel websites. At the time there were a number of reviews circulating which indicated that the hotel was still being built and we wondered what we would find when we got there. However the value for money was just too good to ignore. A four star hotel which even before the price reduction was cheaper than most three star offerings was not to be missed. We neednâ€™t have worried. It turned out to be one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The hotel is superb. There are still minor things which are being sorted out. On one day all but one of the lifts were refusing to work, and some room facilities like the mini bar are still being installed. That said the rooms are spacious clean and comfortable. The TV system carries channels to please every nationality including a full range of BBC options. The bed is huge and comfortable, the bathroom spacious and well appointed. It gets better. On the top floor there is a superb cocktail bar. (Ask Michael, the bar manager, to make you one of his specials. They are divine.) Meanwhile downstairs the hotel has a restaurant which can compete favourably with many of the best in Amsterdam. Venture into the sub basement and you will find a well appointed gym and a heated swimming pool which is maintained at a most agreeable temperature. It was this above all which caught our eye as we have our own pool at home and like to swim every night. The hotel keeps theirs at a pleasant temperature in the high eighties and the chlorine levels are not too high either. Our stay was made all the better by the attentiveness of the staff and their friendly and helpful advice on everything from places to see to how to get around. The hotel is located on the 1 and 17 tram routes about equidistant from Surinam-Plein and Lelylaan. We traveled to Holland by Eurostar and train. If you do the same it worth knowing that the ticket you buy, which takes you to Amsterdam central station, also entitles you to change trains at Amsterdam Schipol. If you do this then you can pick up from there, at no extra cost, a train which takes you direct to Lelylaan station - just one stop! From there it is less than five minutes walk to the hotel. To get from the station to the hotel follow the cycle path through the housing estate turning right onto delftandlaan. Walk approximately 50 yards to the roundabout and cross the road heading west on schipluidenlaan cycleway which goes under the motorway. The track veers round to the left as it emerges from under the motorway. Continue for a further 150 yards until you are just about to go under the roadway for Cornelius Lelylaan. The Fashion Hotel is now directly on your right. The reception area is on the street level You can either climb the steep steps outside or go in via the downstairs entry and take the lift up.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel will definately stay here again if the prices stay as cheap!”
Reviews.Author: kellybecky
Reviews.Content: Like many others I booked this hotel through Lastminute.com as part of their top secret hotels deal. I was really pleased with the price although a little concerned once I had read a few reviews before I arrived. Having travelled with just a friend it was a bit concerning initially that the bathroom has a clear door, (what is that about???) However we soon figured out that if we left the shower running for a while before getting in then the door steams up anyway saving your dignity. We didnt have any trouble with the bathroom flooding as many have stated on their reviews. As we live in the army barracks in Germany we arrived by train to central station so had to ask for directions to the hotel, we were told to get tram 1 or 17 to karrenstraat (not sure if this is the correct spelling) but in actual fact it is much easier to get off at the stop before which is surienemplan (again spelling is probably incorrect) just walk up the road on the left hand side it is much more convenient. We really went for a girlie weekend, as the hotel is out of the city centre and the last tram returns to the hotel around 12.30pm late nights were really out of the question which we were a bit gutted about. A few reviews I read have said the taxis are really expensive but if you get the hotel to prebook you one it was only around 13euros from Leidseplan and it only cost us 20 euros back to central station. Which considering prices in Leeds I didn't think this was bad at all. It is definately worth investing in a tram pass from the hotel, we paid 18euros each for a 4 day pass. Overall I would stay in this hotel again although next year I probably won't be able to afford to as the prices will probably be too high! Oh one final point, if you are going on a girlie weekend don't bother going to the ice bar, yes it is a bar made of ice but believe me the novelty quickly wears off once you're in and you're not allowed to take your own photos and the two drinks they offer is really only one cocktail of pure cheap vodka and cheap juice! Horrible!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: HolidayQueen82
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute.com on a top secret hotel status because I found a really good bargian for 2 nights at this hotel, I was a bit concerned about the location and how some of them found it really hard to find after reading a few of the reviews from other tourists. We arrived at Amsterdam Schipol Airport and visited the Tourist Information Centre as my husband and I needed the cheapiest options available for sisghtseeing and traveliing within the city. We purchased a 48 hour I AMSTERDAM card included all travel within the city but (not the train from Schipol Airport to Leyliaan this was under 3 Euro's per person), gave us free entrance to loads of museums including the Van Gogh Museum, free hour canal cruise with Holland International, 25% off various attractions and restuarants, it also had a number of pages that consisted off vouchers to use in and around Amsterdam. The cost of this pass is 48 Euro's per person and is definetly value for money, otherwise you will get ripped off paying on the trams and buses all day. You can purchase 24/72 passes too depending on how long you are staying. It is really easy to get from the airport, you need to catch the train from Amsterdam Schipol Airport to Leylaan which is about 6 minute ride on the train. From Leylaan you can catch tram number 1 or 17 and get off the stop called SURINAMEPLEIN if you get off the stop before like we did then its a pain to find as you have to go under some subway/tunnel and its not very nice so I can agree with some of the reviews previously on this. If you get off at Surinameplein its the best option as its on the main road and you walk 2 minutes towards the hotel and remember to check your metro cards IN and OUT at the sensors when you get off the tram otherwise your travel pass becomes INVALID! We checked in at the hotel and it was really modern, the staff were polite and helped out where they could. The room that we were booked in was very clean and the beds were made up each day. You have a modern Plasma, tea/coffee facilities, mini bar, iron, ironing board, hairdryer so its all modern and the decor was fantastic. The bed was huge and comfotable too. The bathroom had great decor but be aware if you are travelling with family and you need privacy the bathroom door is see through so not ideal for some people! The swimming pool was lovely and clean and hardly anybody there, they have sunbeds to relax on and also a steam room and sauna room for relaxtion. Towels are provided when you get to the swimming area. If you are staying at this hotel then I recommend you have a dip in the pool. Getting to the city centre is really easy too, you just need to walk on the main road again to the metro stop and catch tram 1 or 17...... Overall I would say this hotel is fantastic, the location is good as I went with my husband but If I went with another female then I would have booked something in the city centre to avoid walking that 2 minute walk along the main road. .... I definetly got my money's worth out of it.... and just before I finish the prices of the food and drink in the hotel is really really expenisve.... for example breakfast was 18 euro's per person which is around Â£17-18 in english pounds.... we just got the tram and went to the city centre and ate at the pancake cafes which did really good food for a decent price!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, though not quite ready”
Reviews.Author: Phil_Murray88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fashion Hotel, Amsterdam for five nights at the end of September 2009. Our total stay cost some Â£315, following an excellent deal from a last-minute travel website. For the price we paid, the hotel was absolutely brilliant. The rooms are beautifully furnished and very spacey. The television has an excellent range of BBC channels, and is very big. The bathroom has a great shower, and we didn't have the problems previously reported about it flooding the entire bathroom (though the room is a wetroom, and thus suffers from typical wetroom 'wetness'). The bed is AMAZING! We had a standard room, and were given a king size bed with very comfortable linen, etc. Great! The facilities in the hotel are also great. When we stayed, the sauna/steamroom/etc. were free to use, along with the nicely sized swimming pool. Using such facilities after a long day in town was a great treat, and made for an excellent holiday. The SKYY Bar is also brilliant, with great views at night. The service in the bar was excellent (served at table, by waiter), and the prices weren't too bad, with very reasonably priced house wine by the glass. Also, the staff at reception are very good and incredibly informative. As for the location, I didn't find this to be too much of a problem. The tram is about five minutes away by foot, and then takes some 15 minutes to get to the town centre proper. I didn't find this arduous at all. Some quibbles: First, some of the furniture in the room was surprisingly shabby, bearing in mind the age of the hotel. A button was missing on the great leather recliner in the room. Also, the paint on the dresser was chipped in places. This is unforgiveable; the hotel is brand new! More seriously, the minibar. Unlike most reviewers, our minibar had been installed. We wish it had not been. The front of the minibar has very very bright lights that cannot be switched off. They filled the room with an eerie blue light on a night. If we had not fashioned some ad hoc cover from the bed's throw, sleeping would have been difficult. Thirdly, the landscaping outside the hotel is far from complete. Building work is everywhere. Though not noisy, it does make the hotel feel less classy. Especially the mass of unswept building dust on the stairs up to the hotel. Finally, the steam room stopped working on the final two evenings we stayed at the hotel. It was not fixed, nor did there seem to be any awareness of the problem. This put a damper on our last night. After cycling 45km in the Dutch countryside, a steam was greatly appealing! All in all, this is a great hotel. If you're going to be paying full price, I'd look somewhere else. The hotel, in six months or so, will be excellent. At the minute, however, it's not quite ready. Hence my giving it three rather than four stars. If you can get a cheap deal, though, then stay here. It really is a lovely hotel, and was really worth the Â£315 we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel but location may not suit first timers!”
Reviews.Author: cateecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our 12th visit to Amsterdam...we love this city! We always hire bikes when we visit so the fact that the hotel is quite a bit outside the main centre didn't bother us, in fact we liked being in a less touristy area. It was really lovely being so close to the Rembrant Park too. The property itself is superb. The rooms are ultra modern and very stylish. The glass door on the bathroom may not be to everyone's taste however. The beds were very comfortable and rooms well stocked with tea/coffee and bathroom supplies. The pool is a great addition although it was a little chilly. Free wifi was much appreciated too. I'll definitely consider staying here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel. Lovely big rooms but not central”
Reviews.Author: JohnHunter1980
Reviews.Content: Very nice new hotel, spacious well equiped rooms. Just one stop from Schipol airport so very easy to get to. 5 minute walk to tram stop - 10 mins to Leidseplein and 20 mins to Dam square. Location not the best - but we knew this when we booked - hotel excellent value though as to get a similar standard in the centre would have cost at least double. Only 1 downside - stayed for 4 nights and room was never properly made up - the kettle, iron etc were left out which is not what you expect for 4 stars. Mini bar wasnt fitted so had no fridge to cool drinks etc but got 2 complementary drinks in the trendy, modern hotel bar which made up for it. Overall was excellent and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Justyna85
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for Bank holiday weekend with my boyfriend. From the airport it's just one stop on the train ( at the airport the ticket machines won't accept notes- coins only, and for some reasons they wouldn't accept any of our credit or debit cards, you can go to the ticket office and stand in a line for a little bit) We were a bit affraid when we got off the train as we didn't check how to get to the hotel from the rail station. We asked people around and although at first they didn't seem to know the hotel, as soon as you say it's the new hotel they are building in the area they will direct you exaxctly where to go. It's about 7 minutes walk to the hotel. The Hotel is finished but they are building some stff just next door and still are doing pavements outside. The hotel was great, the service at the reception fast and efficient, the rooms- brand new, clean, big deep bath tub, separate toilet. The only thing that was a bit odd was the door to the bathroom....which were glass, seethrough doors to the bathroom so lying on the bed you can see everything qwhen sb else is having a shower...not the worse thing when you're with your partner but going with a friend or family could be a bit weird. Yes, the water leakes from the shower area to the sink area but its not that bed and thewy will happily supply more towels for that. The room has coffee/tea set, no minibar yet but instead we were offered a free drink at the hotel bar which is very classy. Tends to be a lot of duch people staying in the hotel. From the reception you can get travel cards for public transport( cover trams, buses and metro) for 1/2/3/4 days ( we got 4 day travelcard for 18 euros) from the hotel it takes 5 minutes to get to the nearest tram stop- 1 or 17- both regular and go to the central station through the center. It takes less than 20 minutes to get to the centre. The last tram back to the hotel is around midnight so thats the only minus if you want to party till late :/ We didn't take cabs but they are VERY expensive there so better not miss the last tram/train. Hotel also had swimming pool and welness center with sauna but we didnt get to use them busy with sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “If you're thinking of booking thisâ€¦ go for it!”
Reviews.Author: UkIsabelle
Reviews.Content: Hello! This is a 4 star hotel in Amsterdam with excellent facilities that is currently offering heavily discounted rates - so yes it is too good to be true... The hotel isn't entirely finished - the outside needs landscaping and half the rooms haven't been completed but what has been completed is very swish. However, I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting a good deal for a short break in Amsterdam! I stayed here with my partner for 4 nights on 17th August 2009 and we had no complaints at all. The rooms are lovely, large and spacious with all modern dÃ©cor. The TV was fully working with plenty of channels including BBC1 which was nice, the WIFI was also fully functioning for the whole stay. There wasn't a mini-bar in the roomâ€¦ but they are a waste of money anyway and there is plenty going on in Amsterdam so who wants to be stuck in a hotel room drinking! The rooms all have air-con which was great, as it was so hot whilst we were there. Don't get a taxi from the airport to the hotel!! Train from airport to Leylaan Station takes 5 minutes, (direction Centraal Station). Buy a single ticket with credit card from manned ticket booth in airport. When at Leylaan Station get off and go down stairs to tram stops - get a tram in direction of Centraal Station - ask for a ticket for 2 stops to Surinamaplein (this takes about 2 minutes)â€¦ keep a look out on your right (facing forwards) and you will see the Hotel Fashion. To get into the town centre use the tram, the nearest stops are a 5 minute walk away in either direction, the best one is Surninamaplein and it takes roughly 20 minutes to get to Centraal Station on the No. 1 or No. 17. Leidseplein is about 10minutes away on the No. 1. You can get a 1,2,3 or 4 day pass from hotel - these work out as cheaper. When this hotel is fully finished it will be even better... but then so will the prices! Go now whilst it's cheap! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel just a shame it wasn't closer to the centre.”
Reviews.Author: missymarly
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, friendly staff and the room was superb! Was a shame you had to walk a abit of a distance for the tram, either going under the bridge or walking on the road, would have been handy to have a shop or two near by to buy drinks nibbles to take back to hotel as no mini bar in rooms as yet and ice machines not plumbed in either, the walk to tram wasn't far but after you have been walking around amsterdam the last thing you want to do is have to do is more walking! lol To get the hotel tv to work switch on at the side of the tv, press the sb button on the control and use the channel up and down button. Trams 1 and 17 are the ones you want to catch, you can buy tram passes from reception for anything from 1 day to a week or so. We went to bols museum and at the end you get a free cocktail, this was probably the best museum we went to lol

Reviews.Title: “A buck goes a long way here!”
Reviews.Author: Retrozzz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!! I am a business traveller. The hotel is brand new. The rooms are BIG and shiny! Big windows. Bus/ tram stop is a 10 min walk away. + King size beds. Free WIFI. Separate toilet. Clean! - Water tends to find its way into the bathrooms while showering. (they know the problem and put down towels though...). The bar is excellent, the restaurant is way overpriced. For under 100 euros/night, you won't find anything better in Amsterdam at the moment. A+

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: daveyboygee
Reviews.Content: The whole place had a great vibe from when you first step in there. Amazing food for the breakfast and nice swimming pool, shame there was a charge to use the sauna which was a bit of a dampner, rooms great, and a nice size.

Reviews.Title: “Fashion at its best”
Reviews.Author: Mia1018
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fashion hotel for two nights, and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel being newly built is spotlessly clean and really chic and modern. The decor is classy and fits in well with the fashion theme. The room we were allocated was on the second floor and was lovely it was big and especially liked the bathroom and modern interior. We had breakfast which was nice with a choice of pastries, cereals, fruit, toast or a cooked breakfast. The location of the hotel was easy to find don't take a taxi as we took a bus from outside the Schipol Plaza that dropped us off at Station Lelyaan which was only a few minutes walk to the hotel. We bought a metro pass from the hotel which cost 15 euros each for 3 days which we found to be very good value. The trip to the centre is a tram ride away and the stop is a five minute walk under the bridge. People are kind and friendly and always ready to help. The weather was good which enabled us to enjoy all the wonderful sites. Would certainly recommend this hotel. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - halfway between airport and Amsterdam centre”
Reviews.Author: ceeci
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was cheap and only openened in July 2009. We stayed at the end of July/early Aug for 3 nights. There were still a few teething problems, but all easily solved and staff helpful if we needed something. Great leisure facilities with a pool, steam room and saunas and in working order and great after a day of lots of walking. The spa treatments were not open yet when we visited but was due to open a couple of days later. Bar was good (but expensive as all hotels tend to be) and the Skybar was not yet open. Bar staff very friendly and helpful and the mojitos were excellent! The hotel was not in the centre (but halfway to airport). The tram number 1 stops about 7 minutes walk from the hotel at Suriname Plein and it is about 6 or 7 stops to the central area of Leidseplein. Trams are very frequent. We bought a 3 day pass with at the hotel reception for 15 Euro. Tram 17 also goes from Suriname plein to the central station. The rooms were spacious, clean and brand new. The mini bar were not installed yet but hotel gave us a free drink in the bar to compensate. There was a safe, iron, tea/coffee making facilities and huge shower room. Nice big and clean bed, flat screen TV and free wireless internet connection. All was working as it should. Food was expensive in hotel . Around Suriname plein there were two nice cafes for reasonably priced breakfast or lunch, or just take the tram towards the town centre. We took a taxi from airport to the hotel at the cost of 33 euro, so taxis not cheap. Taxi driver could not find it easily, so just tell them it is close to Suriname plein. You can instead take a train from the aiport to the nearerst train station which is Lelylaan, about 7 minutes walk to the hotel and cost about 4 euro per person.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning property with the WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: cutecats
Reviews.Content: I booked the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Fashion in March 09 months before it was due to open and when the hotel first opened I saw 2 reviews on here that made me nervous that the hotel was still a building site and rooms were only half ready so I contacted the hotel expressing my concerns and was put at ease so I would recommend anyone who has worries email the hotel direct. When my partner and I arrived on the 31st July 09 for our 3 night stay the only things that werent ready were the sun beds, mini bars and the SKYY bar (sun beds and mini bar were of no concern to us and we both got a free drink as the mini bar wasn't ready) - we would have liked to have seen the view from the SKYY bar. I agree with other comments about the hotel being hard to find simply because no one has heard of it! We booked the shuttle bus and 2 of the staff there hadnt heard of the property, it would actually work out better to take a taxi from Schipol airport to the hotel as it is around the same cost (45 euro for a shuttle return for 2 adults as opposed to around 50 euro for a return ride in the taxi). The hotel, yes from the outside still is a building site however this did not ruin anything at all for us, the tram stop isn't directly outside the hotel as the website claims but is only a very short walk away (when you get off the tram returning back to the hotel there isn't a pavement to walk on so you have to cross the road and go back under the subway to get back). Take tram 1 or 17 to Central Station and when coming back from a night out take the same trams back to Osdorp (think thats correct!) - note tram 1 goes via Leidesplein which is fantastic. A 48 hour tram pass can be bought at the hotel reception for 11.50 per person (a single tram ride valid for 1 hour is 2.60). Again agreeing with other comments, the bathroom does leak when you take a shower but I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. I myself work for a UK hotel group so have very high standards when I am staying at a competitors hotel paying full rates. The hotel is modern and chic, we recieved good service and had one of the best breakfasts I have ever tasted at a hotel. The leisure facilities are fantastic although be warned the swimming pool is very cold!! The beds were so comfortable and the first floor has 2 computers with free internet access, useful for checking up last minute addresses of places to visit. If you are visiting Amsterdam stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel but beware!”
Reviews.Author: jchalmers2
Reviews.Content: Fabulous 4* hotel if you can get to it! Not registered at Tourist Information and the street name is not registered yet either! You need to know its on Nachtwachtstraat. It is out of the city limits and is 30 mins on a tram. We were advised to get off Tram 1 or 17, at Derkinderstr,. We had to carry our cases down some steep stone steps which came out under a bridge, we then had to fathom our way to the hotel. Tip! Turn right, tuen left at the roundabout and under the motorway bridge, keep left and its on your right after the building site. Beware, we were watched from between the bridges! There are then lots of steep stone steps to climb to reception too. Tip! Go in the office/spa entrance on road level and there are a bank of elevators to Reception floor. The hotel Receptionist didn't like it when we complained about the false accusation of a tram outside. She directed us to Suriname which is a good 10mins walk which involves walking on the main road as there is no pavement due to the building site! On a plus, its a fabulous hotel, clean, luxurious, especially for the price. There is tea and coffee making facilities, large screen tv, iron and ironing board. There are also two computers in a shared area on Floor 1, which can be used free of charge. However, the shower does not drain quick enough and the water soon spreads across the floor into the basin area and there is nothing to stop it flowing out of the bathroom and into the bedroom area. The Skybar wasn't open as is not finished yet and there are no mini-bars in the rooms. Better if you travel by car as it has its own Parking.

Reviews.Title: “Half way between airport & city. Perfect”
Reviews.Author: luzosmith
Reviews.Content: We took a chance & booked a "top secret hotel" via Last Minute.Com. It guaranteed a 4* hotel with a rough indication of the area the hotel was located in. Believe me, after trawling through hundreds of hotels, a price of Â£160 for a double room for three nights seemed like a good deal and so we booked. When our hotel name was given to us... we read reviews. None were particularly "glowing" and we became very nervous.... BUT It was a lovely hotel, extremely clean & with plenty of helpful staff. Yes, there is still building work going on outside & there may be a couple of teething problems internally. BUT We had a lovely stay & were not affected by any problems at all. The staff were brilliant. The room was spacious & clean. The location (midway between Schipol & Grand Central) was excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is still being built, but should be nice in a few months”
Reviews.Author: tsaunders
Reviews.Content: We booked through expedia, not knowing that the hotel was only opening 6pm the night before we arrived. The hotel website had quite a few fibs on it. For example it says there is a tram stop outside (no there isn't, it is 10 mins walk away, Surinamplein on routes 1 and 17 from Central Station) and that it is a 5 min walk from Lelylaan station (even if it was properly sign-posted and had signs on the outside of the building it would take at least 10 mins). There was no landscaping at all and from the access road there were only dusty boards to walk over with your case. I dread to think what it would have been like if it had rained. Once we found reception (everything was covered in a layer of dust) the staff were trying their best, but it was obviously a struggle. We were told that only rooms on the first floor were ready but all were occupied so we would have to return a few hours later and our room should be ready. It was also clear that the leisure facilities/spa area weren't ready either; this was one of the reasons we had selected the hotel in the first place, so we were disappointed. It wasn't worth the wait - there was a huge wet area in the middle of the carpet - we discovered the source of this when we turned on the aircon and water poured out. It was at this stage we found the phones didn't work either (great in an emergency???) so we decided enough was enough and returned to reception to complain and ask to be moved to another hotel in the chain. The general manager came out after a few minutes to apologise - he had already booked us into the Arts Hotel and arranged and paid for a taxi to take us there - so we had no complaints with the staff really. I am certain that once complete it will be a gorgeous hotel, but if you are thinking of staying there I would check with the hotel to see how building work has progressed first.
